description:
Best carne asada burrito!!! I lived in San Diego for 20 years and went to Mexico a lot! This place mimics that flavor in all ingredients of the burrito to remind me of Mexico!

Thank you, Taqueria Zorro! The super burrito is so worth the trek! PS it's $11.00 but you're paying for the sour cream and guacamole which is usually extra when asked to add to your burrito!
author: Danette A.

description:
A huge fan of Taco Tuesdays!

The food is quite tasty and the portions are pretty large. I love their salsa bar and their salsa verde in particular! Be aware if you're eating in you can have endless salsa, chips come at an extra price. If you're taking food home you are only allowed to take 3 servings of salsa. This is the only downside for me. Taqueria Zorro is on my way home from work and I like to take food to go so I would appreciate taking a bit more salsa with me because it's so delicious!
author: Inci A.

description: After moving to Russian Hill / North Beach from the Mission, I had a serious withdrawal from Mexican food! Thank god there is Zorro to fill in that gap. They are almost just as good as the taquerias in the Mission but without the lines or hipsters everywhere. My recommendation is to just go with a standard Carne Asada Super Burrito. Super juicy, full of flavor, and gigantic. Just like a porno.
author: Henry W.

description: Carnitas Zorro Buritto? So. Effing. Delish. Perfect for a Friday night!
author: Michelle G.

description:
This taqueria is a solid place for lunch. I like to watch my dollars and for less then $10 you can get a descent burrito with all the fabulous trimmings. Of course the super burrito is a dollar more but you get pretty full just off a regular burrito. And you get complimentary chips and salsa ( the salsa verde is the bomb ).

In the city its hard finding places for lunch under $10. This place isn't an El Farolito but will satisfy your burrito craving for sure.

They have plenty of seating. The vibe is very homey with the traditional music and portraits on the walls. The staff is friendly.

Parking around here is tough, but it is a definitely an easy walk if you work nearby. 

My suggestion for a parking is to park a few blocks away and walk towards Broadway street. It is very crowded since Chinatown is next door. 

My burrito was just okay, it tasted a little under seasoned but I would much rather have it under seasoned then over seasoned to where I needed to toss out my lunch.

Happy eating folks!
author: Kam H.

description: My family and I ate here yesterday! My husband and I ordered super burrito with carnitas. They were big for the price and tasted really good! The only weird thing is that we had corn and peas in it too! I didn't mind it but husband didn't like it. My kids shared the quesadilla meal. It looked and tasted good. Yeah it simple to make but it was good! Not oily! Would I go back? Yes! Also I loved what my receipt said at the bottom! Read yours the next time you order :) Thank you for the delicious food!
author: Ashley A.

description:
I'm not sure if the food was good or bad to be honest. I was super hungry for lunch and went into this restaurant for a quesadilla and a beer. My bill was $10 which wasn't a bad price. They have a salsa bar with salsa that was really good and spicy. The cheese quesadilla was extremely oily. However it tasted really good. I feel like they could have used a lot less oil. One positive was I found a power outlet to charge my phone.

The bathroom situation was probably the worst part since you have to get a key, walk down a flight of stairs and wait for an individual bathroom that there was a long line for. Kinda lame. Overall this restaurant is just meh.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Ordered super nachos with steak and a super al pastor quesadilla. Food is flavorful and they don't skimp, especially since it's bit pricey. 

I love the fact that they have a salsa bar, which is always a plus for me. 

Overall, I think I paid $24~ total and the only bad thing was that they gave me al pastor for both dishes but no biggie. 

Will I be back? Yes, since I live close by and it does the job.
author: Michael T.

description: Unfortunately, I am very displeased with this restaurant. I ordered through uber eats, and specifically noted I wanted grilled steak and refried beans in my super burrito. When I started eating, I could tell something was off and turns out they gave me a chicken burrito with black beans instead. I am allergic to chicken and broke out in hives. Unacceptable if you ask me.
author: Samantha Z.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Wednesday. They had a burrito deal (all burritos $7.99)

Food: I got the veggie burrito (wasn't discounted even when all other burritos are cheaper). It was kind of cold and wet. The veggies in it seemed like frozen veggies (peas, corn). There was basically no flavor and I wasn't crazy about their salsas either. I also got the mango juice which was way too sweet and tasted funky.

Service: No complaints on the service. Ordered and got the food within 10 minutes.

Ambiance: Seems a little run down but has cute Mexican theme decor. Plenty of tables that can easily be moved to make bigger tables. 

Overall won't be back. -_-
author: Hayley D.

description:
The one time I go with my gut to give this place a try beside the reviews it has received. As previous reviews have stated "mediocre" burrito that just filled you up. The meat didn't have any flavor at all-- almost felt like I was just eating a veggie burrito. 

Don't come here--
author: Bryan B.

description: I ordered two chicken tacos and 80% of the tacos was lettuces.  I never had such horribles tacos in San Francisco.
author: Hector S.

description: In need of some late night grub, lo-and-behold this place was still open. It wasn't crowded at all so the service was pretty quick. I got the nachos since I wasn't starving and thought it would be a smaller amount of food but it was a pretty big portion! While it was decent, especially for late night food, it wasn't the best nachos I've ever had. Halfway through, I noticed some of the cheese wasn't even melted. That being said, it's a decent option in the area and maybe some of the other food is better, I'm not sure. I'd give it a shot again if I'm in the area and need something to eat but wasn't overly impressed.
author: Pooja C.

description:
This taqueria is in a great location but it's just mediocre.
The super burrito is your run of the mill burrito. 
It was filling, but it wasn't the best I've ever had.
It doesn't compare to el farolito or la taqueria.
You will have to park far away because it's on a busy street. 
Overall, if your walking through the area and want Mexican food. This place will do in a pinch.
author: Kevin S.

description: Late night delight. Grilled veg burrito was supreme.  The salsa could be better. Staff was nice.
author: Emile B.

description:
I used to really like this place and I don't want to give it a bad review. But I just ordered pick up and 20 mins after when I came to pick it up, they only physically started to make it after I was there. They didn't seem to understand my order either. Didn't separate the chips from my nacho after I specified it. Just put the toppings on small bins, I was barely able to get out, forgot my refried beans.  After I got home, the chips were all soggy and I had to throw the whole thing out.

I don't think their food is bad, they just didn't give a shit when they made mine.
author: Bowen C.

description: I have eaten at many Taquerias in general and many in San Francisco in particular: this is one of the better ones! A good burrito is an art to make, the ingredients have to be right and the method and manner of bringing all together is also a skill. Zorro's gets it right. I went with the Super Burrito steak. O man so full of rich flavor. And the meat was perfect i.e. I did not order extra meat. The side of chips are just right, and the salsa adds more rich flavor. The location is simple, just a place to eat without pretensions. So go as you are and enjoy.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Came here looking for carne asada fries (Zorro Nachos) and my boyfriend ordered the Zorro burrito. I didn't have any of the issues with ordering the way everyone else did and our food came out without problems. The Zorro burrito was excellent with the fries being extra crispy inside. The Zorro Nachos were perfection and just what I wanted. I didn't expect them to be super crispy with all the toppings but they did try their best. My boyfriend remarked that it was probably the best he's had at Zorro's (he's been here many times) so I don't know how consistent the food is in quality and the fries in crispiness based on his comment but I hope it'll continue to be so so I can come back for more!
The restaurant overall is like any Taqueria and it isn't super clean or dirty. It's extremely casual and doesn't have much going for it, but it's the food that's on point.
author: Jenn T.

description: You need to try their Zorro Burrito. ¡It has guacamole and french fries! Definitely good food. :)
author: Brigitte S.

description:
This is our go to drunk/hungover food. We typically get the veggie burrito & zorro burrito w carnitas or chicken. They fill it with a ton of good stuff (fries in the zorro) & the meat isn't dry. It's a good size burrito so there are always leftovers. Nachos are also good. 

The food comes out pretty quick and they give you a side of chips and salsa lids to get salsa from their salsa bar. Love their late night hours !
author: danielle a.

description:
This place might be getting a bad rap from being practically next door to a strip club.  But the Pastor is on a completely different level than the average shop.  Belongs in the same class as the Mission burrito shops.  Yup, I hella went there.

Just get a super burrito with the pastor, gorge yourself on half, take the other half home for your 2 mooch roommates with the munchies.  There's some philanthropy for you.
author: J S.

description: Ordered a large chicken burrito bowl. Kinda light on the meat. Plenty of rice though....
author: Steven S.

description:
Decent taqueria located right on Columbus that has a lot going for it, such as:

Late hours-this place opens at 11am ish and doesn't close until 1 am. Perfect for the late night munchies.

Pricing-in this area everything costs more then you might expect. So tacos for three to five dollars? Quesadillas for six? Decent sized overstuffed burritos for nine ish bucks? Yes, please.

Fresh things. Do I really have to expand on this ? I do? Really? Ok, whatever, they have a great do it yourself salsa bar with a half dozen different options. That is always a wonderful thing to find in a taqueria. But wait there's more-the prep area in addition to being extremely visible (you walk/stand/wait by it before you get to the cashier for ordering.) is always hot and fresh. Nice. They also have a house burrito which is kind of a fusion item. Burrito with fries in it. Just what the late night carbaholic needs.

The Mural. The dining area sports a full wall mural of an episode from Aztec mythology, replete with bathing maidens and leopard men. Bonus points for the little marker explaining the scene.

Things that I'm overlooking for now but otherwise may cost a star or two:

The dining area can suffer from sticky table top syndrome, especially during the lunch and late rush times. 

The staff can be a tad overworked, and thus will not respond to erratic herbal/beer impaired ordering with zestful enthusiasm. 

The bathrooms are down a flight of stairs. Not cool when herbal/beer impaired ordering has occurred.

Overall an easy four stars. Great late night food choice.
author: Steven W.

description:
Stopped by Tuesday, June 16th after the Golden State Warriors game. Was out celebrating the win, so we needed some sustenance to counteract all the beer we'd been drinking.

I decided to get a couple of regular tacos. They're normally $3.65 each, but since it was Taco Tuesday, they were $2.25 each. Score! Each taco comes with your choice of meat, onions, cilantro, sauce. I decided to get the Al pastor: bbq pork & Carne asada: grilled steak tacos. I actually wanted Lengua: beef tongue, but they were out. Both meats were tender and flavorful.

Make sure to grab some salsas from the Salsa bar. They have Habanero sauce, Jalapenos, Green sauce & Red sauce. Since my order came with chips, I grabbed one of each. The habanero packs a punch, so you don't need a full container to add some heat to your tacos. A little goes a long way.

Great place to grab a meal after a night of drinking. I'd been craving tacos for a while, so this definitely hit the spot!
author: Elena N.

description: Oh my WOW! The super quesadilla was absolutely amazing. The green salsa is also a must. We also got the super nacho which was good. The portions are huge so between the two of us we could have just ordered one or the other. We will definitely be making trips into SF to get a quesadilla here often!
author: Megan W.

description: Went here on lunchtime on a Friday. Ordered Zorro nachos. It was good. Had fries, onion, guacamole, chips. Around $10.
author: B C.

description:
Ordered a Super Burrito for take out and felt it was decent, but not spectacular. I did like the fact the burrito was wrapped quite well for takeout and was glad that the burrito wasn't "leaky" and / or soggy. 

Anyhow, I would rate this place a 3/5 but will have to try some other foods out to see if it's better or worse.
author: Drew R.

description: The best tacos in San Francisco. Fast, clean and chip. Chicken meat is delicious. If you want eat mexican food near north beach area this place is number one.
author: Ufuk Emre M.

description:
Their food is pretty decent. Prices are not too bad. I love how they're right next to my job and stay open late sometimes. The food comes out fairly fast. 
One thing I LOVE about this place is their burritos.  Omg so wet and juicy. But their steak is not good. One time it wasn't cooked right and then last night it was overlooked. 
They got my order wrong a few times too. Every time I say no onions I swear they put extra ‍
Tried their steak fries and before I ordered them I asked what all came on there and she put everything on it when I specifically said just queso,  crema, & guacamole. Anyways I might give this place ONE more try before I give up on them fully.
author: Chanel D.

description:
Had the Zorro burrito--packed with beef and it was both good and filling.  The complimentary chips & salsa was good, too.

Can't wait to go back.

12/2017 update
Been back here twice now.  Had the Zorro Burrito again and a Beef Quesadilla today.  The quesadilla was good and hit the spot but for the money,  the Zorro Burrito is the best deal.  This has become a go to place for me.
author: Jim I.

description: I like this place. A local favorite and a quick dinner for me. Recommend the Zorro burritos cause I love 'em fries.
author: anomyous c.

description:
Overall cleanliness in the dining area doesn't seem to be super duper. 
This could be a great burrito place, but the thing that was a total deal breaker both times I went was that the carne asada was so over cooked, it was all dried up, flavorless and nasty. It was actually crunchy. Whoever is cooking up the Carne Asada is cooking it way too long to let it get to this state. Very rookie move!
author: Jim B.

description: Seriously so good. The food is real authentic Mexican food. I have been looking for a place like this since moving to the bay arrea. Its within walking distance of my work and the the food is so dang good. I usually call in my order and walk over to pick it up. All the girls I work with love this place and its obvious why. The people are nice and the food is bomb. What more could you want.
author: Sara S.

description: Visited this place Thanksgiving weekend. Bare bones look, but quesadilla with guacamole was very good, and fairly large. My only issue would be that the order taker was very sullen and unwelcoming. I don't like mechanical service people, but a little cheerful would be nice
author: Jack W.

description:
Solid mediocrity.

If you need late night munchies,

& you're craving Mexican,

I see it.

Otherwise, I'd say pass.

Before Don Pisto's (a sit down restaurant w wait staff as opposed to a taqueria though) opened in North Beach, this was the only Mexican joint in NB proper.  Yeah, there's Taqueria San Jose #3, but that's way outta the way.  This is the hub.  Location, location, location.

Yes, they're open till 3 am on weekends.  You gotta love that, right?  Who hasn't done the too-many-cocktails-out-till-2-without-doing-dinner thing?  And anyone that has done the too-many-cocktails-out-till-2-without-doing-dinner thing in north beach, has come here.

Service is either cool or atrocious.  No eye contact, getting orders wrong, a long wait.  But keep your eye on the prize.  It's an old school taqueria.  Absolutely no frills.  

Their burritos are pretty solid.  Easily the best thing on the menu.  A friend of mine always orders the chicken quesadillas suiza, though, & insists they're good.  Better than average, though?  Nope.

Ultimately, a cheap Mexican place that's not really that cheap.  

2 & 1/2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: I came here to eat with my friend and the chicken tasted raw and it was pink. The food is disgusting and overpriced, don't eat here.
author: L J.

description: Ordered Super Nachos with (our choice) of carne asada meat. Although the portion was huge, plenty to eat for two, the price tag of the nachos with two soft drinks was over $18. That's very steep even if the nachos were exceptional - which they weren't. The dish was loaded with sour cream, guacamole, salsa and cheese, but trying to find the actual meat proved to be difficult. I think they put more carne asada in just one taco. The flavors were decidedly bland - just meh. Also, a small bottle of Coca Cola came to $3.10! Ouch. I won't be back.
author: Phil T.

description:
It's early in the morning, you're drunk as hell and all of a sudden you get this craving for Mexican food (if ya know what I'm talking about give me a high five! ) Luckily, you're also in North Beach and until the first train goes back to the subs you have a couple of hours to kill. You could forsake yourself one more time to have chosen the subs over the city as a place to live (read: sleep) OR you could just forget about all of this, feel happy that Cinco De Mayo is knocking on the door and step into this Taqueria named Zorro.

What you'll find are all your favorite Mexican dishes and literally more than you could possibly eat, even in this drunken state of mind. Go crazy with delicious fish tacos ($4), big fat burritos ($7), quesadillas ($3), cheese over nachos ($7) and a massive salsa bar. Food coma guaranteed.

Oh, one more thing: there's enough space for you and your entourage. Come in and find out.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Everything I personally expect from a taqueria. The California burrito (aka zorro burrito) is always delicious. I LOVE their salsas! I'm simply addicted to the green and red salsa they make and consume it in very unreasonable quantities. This place is always the good choice for a quick and yummy Mexican food.
author: Justyna M.

description:
I was craving late night tacos and decided to Postmates from Taqueria Zorro because the delivery fee was only $5. 

I noticed that the prices of the food are a bit higher than other taquerias in the Mission. 

When I got my food, I can tell the ingredients were a bit higher quality. The onions in my tacos were slightly pickled (which I liked!) and had a purple-y tone. They were also sliced very thinly which was appetizing. They have heaping mounds of meat on the tacos, very generous portions. The al pastor and carne asada were both juicy and flavorful.

The only thing I regretted ordering was the chorizo torta (Mexican sandwich). The chorizo was very salty and tasted processed. 

Hope the delivery fee stays cheap!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I agree with the other reviewer who said that this place is fine for late night munchies but little else. If you're hungry, craving Mexican food, and already nearby then go for it. Otherwise, don't bother.

I got a taco salad with refried beans. The shell was crispy and there was certainly enough of everything but both the beans and the rice were so lacking in flavor that it was difficult to taste anything but the onions and salsa. It filled me up but didn't satisfy in the way great Mexican food should. My dinner companions had a shrimp taco and chips with guacamole. The taco looked fine but the guac was watery and bland like it had been diluted with something.

Chips were good and the salsa bar offers both red and green salsa, plus pickled jalapenos.

Service was friendly and helpful and the prices weren't at all bad for SF.
author: Ellery D.

description:
Looks like the friend I came here with already rated this place with our experience! But here's mine -

We were craving carne asada fries and Taqueria Zorro popped up on Yelp. This may have been mostly my fault and the cashier didn't hear me clearly or something, but our orders came out as the Zorro burrito instead of the nachos (fries). Not a big issue, but we were both craving mostly just the fries part, just not wrapped up in a burrito. 

I lived in San Diego for a few years due to school, so I am very familiar - maybe too familiar - with California burritos and carne asada fries. I didn't have high expectations, but the burritos we had were surprisingly flavorful! It was so flavorful that it kinda threw me off - just didn't seem to pull the burrito together that well. I wish mine had more fries and for them to be more crispy/fresh, and less sour cream, but now I know what to expect. The size was decent and filled me up. My friend had a problem with his burrito because it was poorly wrapped. I kept mine wrapped up within the foil, so make sure you eat it that way if you're having wrapping problems.

There's water available near the salsa bar, however... there seemed to be really old limes laying at the bottom of the cooler as 'flavor'. I noticed right away but was thirsty. Mistake. Definitely tasted like old stale lime water... but I sucked it up and drank it all because water is water. :\

The place was busy for a late Thursday night, so that was welcoming. Definitely one of the cheaper options in the neighborhood.
author: Shanise M.

description:
Absolutely underwhelmed by the quality of my overpriced super burrito here. 

I came here to watch one of the Warrior's Finals playoffs games here one evening because they had a television in the back. I noticed the menu prices here at Taqueria Zorro are more expensive than your typical taqueria. I didn't want beans in my carne asada burrito burrito and asked if I could have a double serving of rice instead. The cashier denied my request :/

The steak inside my burrito was overcooked and lost any flavor it originally had. There was too much salsa inside my burrito, but that's just a personal preference. Their homemade chips came with my meal, but those also tasted stale. In a neighborhood dominated with Chinese and Italian restaurants, Taqueria Zorro failed to meet or exceed my expectations. I shall continue eating Chinese and Italian within the North Beach vicinity.
author: Philip M.

description: This Mexican spot is right in central North Beach. It may seem like a tourist joint, but I am a local, and I thought it was good. I had a burrito zorro that came with french fries and chicken. It was a good meal. I'd go back.
author: Denise C.

description: The chips aren't great, and the prices are a little steep, but they've got a bomb California burrito. It's called the Zorro burrito, but it's a California. Instead of rice and beans, you get fries inside of your burrito, and of course you're going to choose some spicy, tender al pastor, which drips from its marination juices. Not the biggest or cheapest burrito you'll ever get, but they close at 1am, and everything comes out super quickly, even the burritos. It'll hit the spot for sure. Don't be surprised. Just because it's on Columbus, next to all the fancy Italian restaurants (and strip clubs), this place is still a hole in the wall. The tables are crooked, the seats are dirty, and the salsa bar is hopping.
author: Danny C.

description:
It has been a week since I last ate here and I'm still dreaming about their nachos. 
Came across this place after I left Rogue around the corner, ordered some nachos with half carne Asada and half chicken to go. Total was about 12-13$ if memory serves me right- I remember thinking was crazy expensive. I got back to the hotel and I could only eat about half of the order. It was so filling, tasty, and absolutely worth the money. It's on my list of places to visit next time I'm back in the Bay Area.
author: Heyyou C.

description: The worst Mexican restaurant in San Francisco! Bad service and over priced for Mexican food by far! $4 + for a very small taco LOL no way! Stay away!
author: David F.

description:
I found this place to be an ok place to go to. Prices are not that bad comparing to the stores around it and the food was good. Here was my visit.

When a friend of mine and I arrived there after the night event at The Exploratorium (totally should go there, it's a fun an interactive and serves drinks if you are 21+) we were craving for carne asada fries which they had it under the name of "zorro nachos." When my friend ordered for us we later found out that the lady misheard her. Instead of zorro nachos, they gave us a zorro burrito which is totally different. I understand that human error can happen and we could've looked at the receipt to make sure that she put in the order correctly, but regardless, when you expect to get one thing and get another, you get a little disappointed (even then, the title of the food just read "2 Carne Asada Zorro Bur" which by glancing at it, you would think that your ordered is right). 

My friend and I said oh well, we were hungry, and the carne asada fries were essentially the inner body mass of the zorro burrito. I opened mine and found mine to be not well wrapped. This caused my burrito to fall all of its bits out and into the plate and from there I finished it with a fork. Not exactly an ideal situation if you were to order a burrito. The burrito itself wasn't that at all, just a little strong in flavor to my taste. I feel that maybe they added a little too much onions on mine. 

Overall, I would give this place another shot to see what the Zorro chips are like and see what is the difference. If it impresses me, I'll come back. If not, I'll try find another place to eat that's near to the Exploratorium.
author: Tito G.

description: Satisfactory at best. Zorro's is good if you want decently palatable Mexican food but are way too lazy to venture into The Mission. All the burritos here have been just fine, but I don't think I'm going to come back because my body is a temple and temples don't settle for "just fine" burritos. The service here parallels the food: not crappy enough to complain about, but not great either. Mehhhhhhh - there are so many other cool lunch spots within a 5 minute walk from here. I'd only recommend Zorro's if you're desperate for average Mexican food.
author: Desiree S.

description:
TLDR: https://media0.giphy.com/media/sryUjzuFelzKU/giphy.gif

This is a story.

A story about a boy and his burrito.

A story about a burrito that was wolf in sheep's clothing. 

Preparation was swift. No smiles, just lazy smirks. Handed over in a lukewarm foiled shell.

The boy cowered into the corner, alone, cradling this burrito.

"you'll ease the pain, you always do" he whispered to himself.

he slowly undressed it with his eyes, running his fingers along its dips and curves.

He slowly peeled off the first layer and nibbled, just how it likes it.

First bite: confusion.

Second bite: emptiness.

Third bite: heartbreak.

He trotted back to his kingdom, disappointed, only to spend the next 20 minutes playing flappy bird (THE ORIGINAL) on his outdated smartphone.

The truth finally reveled itself: its called Zorro because it literally slices into your intestine and creates a pathway to exit your body in the most ungraceful way possible. 

Conclusion, do yourself a favor and save some time. Just place that burrito directly into the toilet.

The end.
author: Ryan L.

description: I love tacos; I hate to call these fake places out. However, I ordered 6 tacos and was shell shocked with the $25 dollar price tag. Cancelled my order and hope y'all steer clear.
author: Moy G.

description:
I could not be anymore disappointed... For staters I worked 3 years at a place similar to this. I am aware that costumer service is not a priority, I however was very disappointed. 


Now since I worked at a place very similar to this I knew better than to ask what items on the menu are not available. The cashier mentioned a few, but nothing of my interest.I ordered a torta De milanesa (fried steak sandwich), chicken nachos supremos, and a carne asada burrito. 

Once the nachos were ready ,they informed me that they were out of bread, I wasnt okay with that, because  I had already asked If they could make me a torta and they had said yes.. Instead I asked for a refund. As far the carne asada burrito goes, they never made it for me, so I also got a refund. 

I understand how tough is working at a place like this, with only one cashier and two cooks. I been there, but how can you forget to serve me a burrito when we are the only ones there? How can you tell me there is tortas and then once i think my food is coming you inform mw there is no bread? I myself used to forget to serve food at times but I had a line that would end at the door and have cars on the drive-thru.

Now the bathroom they have should only be used if you just cannot wait. It has a disgusting smell that I'd you decide to go in there you may end up saving money because you will no longer want their food.
author: Teresa Isamar D.

description:
Why do I always crave Mexican in the wee hours of 2am?! 

Especially when I'm in North Beach. Where there are a thousand Italian restos, but not a lot of taquerias.

Thankfully, Taqueria Zorro is conveniently open til 3am on the weekends to serve the clubbing/drinking/gentlemen club crowd around the area. Not to mention that New Sun HK resto is the nastiest thing (read: last choice, but salted fish fly lice, me love you long time!) after drinking and dancing all night.

Give me carnitas tacos and some greasy nachos anytime. They also come with a salsa bar? ay carumba.
author: Janice C.

description: This place is the bomb, usually after a night of shenanigans this is a must stop for me. Usually after having a few drinks. I usually get a carnitas burrito "Zorro" style which is the beans and rice switched out with French Fries, or some places would say "Cali Style" The menu is full of options and the prices are reasonable. Defiantly one of my fav mexican food spots in the greater Bay Area.
author: Tre S.

description:
So it's a given from my last review that I REALLY like the carnitas here. Crispy fried, yet moist on the inside, and wonderfully seasoned. Many more return visits, some sober ones even, I believe it's time to bump my neighborhood taqueria up to full stars!

Here's a new find for me - the grilled fish tacos. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/taqueria-zorro-san-francisco?userid=DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw#5PwMZRk5nRvZgCJLhpJhPw) So yummy. The fish has the nice charred flavor but was still moist. The salty seasoning was balanced nicely with the lime and the pickled red onion. Throw in some red cabbage for crunch and texture, you've got perfect balance of flavor and texture in every bite. It's now a toss up between the carnitas and fish tacos for me here.

Not everything is a hit here - I found the lengua to be a little tough. However when you consider the nice friendly folks who serve you here, afore-mentioned carnitas and fish tacos, and not to mention great deals like $1.75 taco Tuesday and $6.50 burrito Wednesday, Taqueria Zorro is tough to beat in North Beach - A neighborhood fave.
author: Jon L.

description: If you're in the area and want a late night bite to eat then I highly recommend this place. It's better than any other fast food you can get. Although it gets pretty busy in there and crowded with a bunch of drunk people, food is actually pretty good.
author: G A.

description: Newbie Californian just tried fries inside of a burrito. Pretty good. Def get the green salsa
author: Alexia S.

description: Got a chicken burrito and a few bites in realized there was a thick long black hair inside. $13 down the drain. Never going here again.
author: Alexandria K.

description: My favorite part is that they accept Yelp orders. Arrive early to avoid traffic. 4 stars because their bathroom is gross and speed of service isn't fast. Although, good customer service, and fresh ingredients.
author: Stan Y.

description: Solid taqueria. Love their huevos con chorizo and the staff is usually pretty nice. Sometimes they offer Milanesa torta which is really good. Their Zorro burrito is ok but if they didn't use really cheap frozen fries and instead used really good quality house cut crunchy fries it would be a burrito that would make history.
author: Brandon D.

description: Ridiculous pricing. I've been waiting here for awhile and I've never had to pay so much for 3 tacos ! Literally spent 20 for 3 tacos and a coke. On top of that I paid $4 extra dollars for avocado?! What the hell. At least they tasted decent but next time I want tacos I'll go to the mission where I know I pay 1.50 per taco and not 3. I'd hate to see their pricing for taco Tuesday's. Not ok.
author: Angel L.

description: The supreme burrito was really yummy, but the eggs and fries in the huevos rancheros were juuussst passable. The eggs were too hard to be over easy, the fries might've been sitting out a while beforehand. You'll be full though, that's for sure!
author: Candy L.

description:
We came in for lunch and was able to still order breakfast huevos con chorizo very well proportioned and very tasty.....also had a order of the NACHO ZORROS and they are incredibly along with there service ....

Most definitely coming back in the future..
author: Hector Z.

description:
Near North Beach / Telegraph Hill, Russian Hill and Chinatown?
Looking for a restaurant to satisfy Mexican Cuisine Cravings?
Taqueria Zorro is here for you!

Here are some of the items I ordered today:
- Veggie Taco with Cheese, Beans, Rice, Guacamole, Lettuce, Sour Cream & Sauce*
- Jarritos Mango Flavored Mexican Soda*

*My first taco at a taqueria. I've been ordering Burritos and Quesadillas from my previous taqueria visits. Today, I digged in to ordering a Taco.
*I am absolutely addicted to these Mexican sodas for some reason. This is probably the fourth or fifth flavor I have tried.

- Nice staff members,
- Good food and service,
- Clean spacious facility

Overall, positive first time experience here. I enjoyed the veggie taco I had, it was delicious and I am so craving for another one while writing this review. Burritos, Nachos and Quesadillas are something I will try next time I come.

Parking: Street / Metered Spots

Public Transportation is of convenience and a smarter alternative.

This taqueria is among one of the dining establishments in the area open till 1 or 2 in the morning. Perfect spot for those late night cravings. Their hours of operation may have changed and it is printed right on the menu. So feel free to take a look at the menu posted on the door before walking in.
author: Bennett W.

description:
I am simply disappointed with this restaurant. With all the great authentic taqueria's in SF it amazes me that this place is even open.  For what I ordered, it was extremely over priced. The quality was poor and presentation was dismal. It's sad because everything sounded so good on the menu. 

My hubby and I ordered off of Waiters.com and that was very pleasurable experience. However, what came was an utter disappointment. 

Ordered the following:
2 pollo tacos
2 carnitas tacos
1 carne asada taco

All meat was seasoned with the same seasoning. How do I know? I found a bay leaf in both the chicken and pork tacos. All tacos were weighed down with lettuce making them mini salads.  This was disturbing because lettuce was not in the description on the menu.  The chips tasted bought and not home made, which is beyond confusing to me. They tasted like chips from a local delivery service that delivers to many taqueria's around the city. Why would you waste money buying your chips when you can make your own and they'll be a thousand times better? 

It's a shame. With the other options out there for taqueria's, I will not be going to this place again.
author: Jamye K.

description:
Went in for burritos last night, first time trying it out. Used online order for pickup, which was easy to use. Staff was nice and had my order ready early. 

The burritos were AWESOME. I used to live in New Mexico; this place has very authentic flavors and generous portions. Grilled chicken was seasoned to perfection, obviously a family recipe. You can ask for no cilantro, that alone makes this place 10x better than that chipotle stuff. Even the tortilla was flavorful. 

The salsas are also great, at least the red and green. I did not try the others yet, but I will be going back to try more for sure!!

Update: order online. Tried to order at the counter the other night, got the wrong size, wrong salsa, and almost got charged for three burritos instead of two. I could have placed the order with the guy making the food and had no problems, but the girl at the register just did not understand what I was saying.
author: Sara G.

description:
This is written after the last time I ever go back to Taqueria Zorro. I have lived in North Beach for the past 6 years and this place has systematically started to screw its customers over and over again with in the past year. They used to be a place that just Didn't F#ck up Mexican food but now they figured out how to do it. It greasy, unrecognizable and over the past year they have added 50 cents  to everything every 3 months to their increasingly shitty food. 

They are now the most expensive and worse Mexican food in San Francisco. Unless your drunk and will not remember your experience go anywhere else. Best option is to go to Don Pisto's a few blocks away. Its 10,000X better food and surprisingly cheaper with a 20,00X better atmosphere. 

This place has self destructed and if you spend money here, YOU ARE A SUCKER. 

P.S.  After 10 pm add a dollar to whatever the menu says and wait for the blank stare 
from the 17 year old that doesn't know how to explain why.
author: Mike K.

description: Best norcal burrito i can consistently have in the city (ok, north of mission). Churn out orders, and even a line rarely backs them up. Great mexican for good prices. High quality ingredients, excellent salsa s and specials are worthwhile
author: Linn K.

description:
Phat burritos! I had the breakfast burrito and it was yummy the salsa was spicy the way i like it... but the cashier lady taking our order not so friendly.. she needs to cheer up or something lol
A plus is that they bring your order to you if your dinning.. another plus is you can view how they prepare your food.. so the kitchen is out in the open. The menu pretty plain and simple and in the back dinning area has the sports spanish channel... I will mos def return to grab a quick bite....
author: Linda B.

description: Two things you must try if you come here. Their super nachos with bbq pork and refried beans with everything on it, and their special Zorro burrito.
author: Johnny N.

description: So let me start out by saying the food here is ok. What I am rating this disgusting place about is its stealing employees. I went to this place on Saturday. Bought nachos which totaled $10.62. I left no tip as this was a take out order. I get an email from my credit card company several days later stating that they noticed an unusually large tip of $8 on my $10 meal. These scumbags wrote themselves in a $8 dollar tip! And then forged their signature on my credit card receipt. I'm disgusted that a place can try to pull such dishonest behavior. Beware, if you use your credit card here make sure they give you the final credit card printout. Best yet, avoid these lying, stealing people like the scrum they are. I guess I showed them. I disputed the entire bill and these losers aren't going to receive a penny of my hard earned money. Please watch out fellow yelpers. These people at this dirty taqueria are no good liars and thieves!!
author: John C.

description: The food was good. Having grown up eating Mexican food my whole life I felt that is place was Okay! Pretty average. I had the carne asada plate which the meat was cooked perfectly but the rice, beans, and salsa were just okay. I believe the salsa if the most important part of a Mexican dish and this salsa did not meet my expectations.
author: Maria J.

description: Amazing burritos. I don't know what this 3-star nonsense is about but the food is consistently delicious. Just go!
author: Genny C.

description:
Sometimes visit this place but no more
My patience is limited.
Terrible service Terrible attitude so mean and rude employee and owner.
I don't know why those emploees are there.
Food is below average.
Like this food place have to kick out from northbeach.
author: thomas p.

description: Gotta love the fajitas! Great place to stop by for some fast comfort food.
author: Annette O.

description:
The taco salad was horribleeeeee.... I asked for no sour cream and swap out the greens for just spring mix or something when I ordered but they honored neither of the requests in the end. The lengua was alright. The bowl wasn't the fluffy crispy kind.  IT JUST MADE ME SAD.

Apparently they have good burritos sigh.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I honestly don't really remember much of this place.

My drunken ass ended up with a flour quesadilla.
All I remember was "this is ok" and then dipping it into their hot sauce and thinking "ugh, gross.. I'm skipping this sauce".

Since our group was all drunk and stuff, we wanted to use the bathroom.  We were sad to see "out of order" sign on it.  Then we saw this guy come out of the bathroom with a key.  I don't know if they use the sign so homeless don't just use it or whatever, but I'm so glad we got to use the bathroom.  I wasn't happy about it being SO so SO dirty.  It had an empty fuji water bottle in the toilet floating around.  WTF? How does that happen?  At least clean it once in a while or something.

Definitely not coming back here!  On top of it, it's CASH ONLY!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Stopped by on our way to the strip club, lol. The food was pretty good, pretty standard taqueria food. The burritos are giant. The place was pretty dirty, but it was also really busy that night. It was the night before the Super Bowl, so there were definitely more people out than normal.
author: Amy P.

description:
I came here last night on Valentine's Day to get something to eat. I ate a carnitas quesadilla and my friend had the same.
It was really good. I especially liked their jalapeño sauce they provide for the chips. I put it on my quesadilla to. It was a good size, I couldn't eat all of it at that time.
It's a little small, but the food is good. They have a bathroom downstairs as well.
author: Melissa S.

description: OMG!! I just happened to walk into this place when walking down Columbus Street. They have hands-down the best shrimp tacos ever! I have literally been trying out shrimp tacos from every taco shop that I go to ever since I left San Francisco, with the hopes that someone will come close to the tacos that I enjoyed here. I have yet to find another taco shop that can imitate what Tacos Zorro created. I got the shrimp tacos and add sour cream. Simply amazing! The next time I'm in San Francisco I making a beeline for Tacos Zorro
author: Janell D.

description: Seriously.....it's 11pm and almost everything is closed except for this gem.  I had the burrito and Nicole had a quesadilla, both were comparable to Mission street.  If you're in the area, eat here!
author: Nick R.

description:
Was lured with the idea of french fries in my burrito. Then I was delivered a tortilla with soggy potatoes cut in the shape of french fries. Will never return.

Spices way too mild, even their spiciest salsa seemed like it came from a jar. That was opened a few weeks ago and never sealed properly.

Nothing about my burrito was worth eating - the chicken was bland, and I can't even remember what the chorizo tasted like.

The biggest disappointment is - there's literally no reason for it to be this bad. Fry the fries for about a minute longer. Spice up the salsa. Add seasoning. *anything*
author: Jeremy T.

description:
My very first burrito, exactly twenty years ago, came from Taqueria Zorro.. 

And my 365th burrito also from the same taqueria was today.

You know what that means?

I have accumulated a year of my life at this same taqueria. 
 
I have also keep track too.

You can say, I'm a "loyal patron" and a "dork". 

Why do I like coming here?

Because it is located in Chinatown, Taco for $1.50 on Tuesdays and Burrito for $6.00 on Wednesdays.

In honor of my milestone-visit of this taqueria, the shop has newly-introduced the "Zorro" Burrito. The $6.00 burrito has a choice of meat, sour cream, avocado and french fries in a flour tortilla. The filling reminds me of a dish I've had when I was San Diego-Carne Asada over French Fries. The special burrito is not as filling as an ordinary Burrito-minus the rice and beans. The meat was charred nicely. But the fries were too overcooked and too crispy. 

Maybe I'm use to eating fries with my burger. 

This place is one of my five-star places for a "Silver-Bullet." But the special burrito is kind of a disappointment on my milestone meal. 

Cash only and a favorite of Yelp's too. 

I will continue to eat here and hopefully get to the 1,000th visit and burrito plateau from this taqueria.
author: Matt G.

description:
They constantly screw up every order placed in advance and are cutting back on meat portions. I keep paying for items that I don't receive. It's more disappointing each time I give them another chance. 

This used to be the place to go for Mexican food, but it's a luck of the draw to get what you paid for these days. 

2 stars because if your lucky enough to catch them on their A game,  you can enjoy a great meal here. Unfortunately, that's not often the case.  

Boost your attention to detail and be fair with portions.  That's where you need to improve.
author: Eric B.

description:
Like many of the other yelpers on this page, I give Zorro's a solid 'meh' on the rating scale. They aren't bad, but they aren't amazing either. I have been to this establishment many times, as I work nearby, and each time has been almost disappointing. They are also pricey for burritos, but I think that has more to do with their location than anything else. Most places near North Beach are pretty expensive unless you count the dirt-cheap Chinese stores a block over. 

Some days for lunch, I get a sudden craving for a good burrito. While I'm dreaming of El Farolito's or Taqueria Guadalajara, I head to Zorro's because they are close and I don't get long breaks. They're located near several strip clubs and if you keep walking up Columbus you'll find a tasty place called Pizzelle Di North Beach. There have been days I have walked to Zorro's for lunch, stood in the doorway for a second, then kept walking to Pizzelle's. That is how unremarkable Zorro's is. 

I've had their tacos once, and haven't tried them since. It was as if they were inedible. 

Normally I go for their burritos. They are not only crazy bland most days, they are also ridiculously messy. The tortilla is greasy and flaky, but somehow also doughy? The inside is just a mess. The whole thing usually falls apart halfway through and I end up having to pick up bits of onion and meat and pretend I'm eating my meal like the adult human being I am. 

So why give this place three stars instead of two? 
Well I've mentioned this place is close to where I work, and the staff is pretty friendly. 
They have juice there, which I actually like. Horchata's a disappointment, but I like their pineapple or mango juices. They're cheap and watery. 
Unlike some taquerias, Zorro's will include a little bag of chips with your order of a burrito. I think they put it in for you to scoop up the bits of your burrito after it disintegrates to a pile of mush. 
They are open late, like most places on Broadway and Columbus. 
Finally, despite the criticisms I've given, they ultimately do what they set out to do. They make burritos. While this seems like a small thing, I appreciate that there's a wide selection of food in the area. It would be so easy for NorthBeach/Chinatown to become a sea of the same overpriced Italian and underpriced Chinese food, and the occasional milk tea joints sprinkled in. So what if they're not stellar or terrific? Let them serve average and mediocre food! 

And if you want to get really good burritos, go to the Mission you lazy bum! :D
author: Claire A.

description:
The food is subpar. My bf and I got the zorro bowl with carne asada. Basically a bowl with iceberg lettuce, some shredded white cheese, small pieces of carne asada, and watered down guacamole.

The bowl reminded me of something I could get at Taco Bell or El Pollo Loco.

You order at the counter, sit down at a table, then go pick up your food when your order is ready. 

Overall, there's much better Mexican food in SF and better restaurants in this area. I'd skip this place.
author: Ella C.

description:
Nothing beats a Mission burrito, but these days getting out to the Mission is inconvenient for me so I'm pretty happy when I find a reasonable facsimile.

There are a few almost-Mission-standard taquerias peppered here and there throughout the city, and Zorro is one of them. In the dozen or so times I've been there over the years, I've found it to be consistent in price and quality.

They have $1.50 Taco Tuesdays and $6 Burrito Wednesdays (regular, super or wet, any protein except shrimp). There's a small salsa bar with three types of salsa, plus lime wedges and marinated jalapeño/carrot mix. There's plenty of seating and a TV that is invariably tuned to a soccer game.

It's nice to be able to get a decent burrito in North Beach, especially since the only other competition closed last year (replaced by a Nizario's Pizza). Give them a shot next time instead of your usual post-booze pizza slice!

P.S. Cash only.
author: Valeria R.

description: This place sucked, the carnnitas pollo asada and Carne asada sucked, the burrito taco and torts I has was nasty, no re do here.blahh
author: Ace B.

description: The food was Delicious. Fresh and authentic .we ordered nachos, tacos and steak dinner. And everything was really good, except for the Cashiers bad Attitude
author: Irma S.

description: This is really a three and a half stars but opted to be nice.  I got the Asada super burrito not bad but not great either. The steak was a little chewy then there were peices that were really tender and good. The beans we're over cooks but it had a nice balance of meat rice and Abrams not like at other places where you usually get a lot of one thing in your burrito. Over all it was okay... Not great not bad but okay.... Keep at it zorro! You have potential
author: Dominic A.

description:
Sorry to lay this on the Z.

I used to be OK with Taqueria Zorro, but after multiple times in a row of feeling awful afterward, I don't think I can go back.

They give very good portions of food for an OK price, but that's just it, the food is the heaviest brick you can put down. And the flavor just isn't really there. Maybe it would help if I didn't finish my whole burrito.... but I love finishing my burrito, so yeah, I'll just hit up a burrito spot that doesn't make me feel this way.

This is a food only review though. The staff is nice, and the ambiance is OK (for a Mexican joint).
author: Peter M.

description: Girl at counter needs attitude adjustment. Says open at 11am. All I got was a bad look and no service. If you don't like your job, quit.
author: Juan V.

description:
Came here 'cuz I had a Tippr deal to use ($10 value)
Got a burrito and large drink - after tax paid $.50. So, price was pretty standard, esp. in the North Beach area.

Burritto: Nothing special but hits the spot when you need Mexican food and there's not too many options around the area.
Strawberry agua fresca: Tasted watered down and kind of like kool-aid......

They were pretty fast at getting my order down though, so that's a big plus.
author: Emily C.

description:
Decent al pastor tacos place in the North Beach/Chinatown border. I could barely finished three tacos however...don't know if because buzzed or a stomach of beers. Must return when less imbibed for an update.

While a good size and lots of seating, the place gets crowded on weekends. But, it's a good choice if in the area and want a taqueria fix.

Didn't notice in the other reviews but there are two small tables for six and a table for two near the front door, and the many counter seats. More than expected for this small divy noodle house. Again, the major drawback is the parking, which is aggravated by the one way streets, the no left turns allowed areas and the meter maids. ):(
author: Peter L.

description: For its quality, it's way overpriced. Two tacos will cost you over 10 bucks and still leave you hungry for more. I haven't tried their burritos yet, but if I'm back maybe I'll give that a try. The quality of the food itself is so so, but there aren't that many mexican places in the area so you gotta take what you can get
author: Amaresh S.

description:
28$ for 6 regular Carne asada tacos and two drinks?  I've paid this much for tacos before and more than happy to do so if they're good....

The Carne asada lacked flavor. Nothing special at all.  Free chips and salsa. Salsa was good but chips were stale. Don't think I'll be coming back here.
author: David S.

description: I work nights and phone ordered a few different things off the menu for myself and co-workers. We will never be ordering from this place again and barely touched what they tried to call food. Not to mention they didn't even give us 2 of the burritos we ordered.  This place is a joke!
author: Jasean W.

description:
Taqueria Zorro could get away with being a lot worse given that it's the only "real" Mexican place for like half a mile in any direction, and it's right in the heart of North Beach Drunk Jagoff Central. It's not one of the top taquerias in the city but 4* just for actually holding themselves to this much of a standard of quality when there doesn't really seem to be a financial need to do so.

Burritos and nachos start at a little over 7 bucks. That's a bit higher than most SF taqs but to be fair they do also give pretty hefty sized portions and their meats are generally pretty good. You can also get pinto or black beans here and you get free chips w/ a salsa bar. Tacos a little over 3 for a regular, a little over 4 for a super. They have some more authentic stuff like lengua and that goat head soup on Sundays too. 

Only minor disappointment is that they used to have really nice fried carnitas a few years ago, but now they seem to just be doing the easy pot roast style that most places cop out to these days.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
This place needs to work on their customer service. I'm not asking for the employees to be overly enthusiastic, but at least offer a genuine smile or a "how are you". 
Oh & why aren't the chips complimentary? I'm paying $3.29 for one taco, I think I deserve a side of six chips. 

The food is pretty good, but the customer service is horrible.
author: Alaina T.

description:
Cheap beer + 1.75 tacos on Tuesdays! I'm game. 

Tacos come in many options like chicken, steak, fish, etc. 

You also get a batch of chips too! 

This is the spot if you work in the Financial district. It's about a 10 minute walk and plenty of good eats. I honestly only came here for Taco Tuesdays and they had a 6 bottle mini corona for $10! 

There's plenty of seating too. Maybe I'll come back for the regular food.
author: Adam J.

description: Some of the worst tasteless Mexican food you can have, not to mention overprice. I think they stay in business because they are the only Mexican food in the area. If you enjoy Mexican food, please avoid this restaurant!!!
author: Uriel A.

description:
This is where wahoo drunks from across the bridges and tunnels stumble into after hours for a carb load to soak up the booze. 

The Zorro burrito: instead of rice and beans, french fries! Pretty good!

They have a rear room with more tables and a TV, and serve cold mini buckets of Corona on ice. 

They have a lot more than burritos here, pretty much everything you would find at any decent Taqueria. 

If you are going to eat a lot of beans, get your lap dance next door at L'Il Darlings beforehand, so you don't stink up her tiny outfit afterwards.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
Taqueria Zorro is the best Mexican spot in the area (not that there are a ton of competitors in north beach/ nearby FiDi), and in comparison to other taquerias in the city is pretty solid. Since I work close by, this is usually my go to spot with my other options being chipotle or the tacos san buena truck. 

Taqueria Zorro's tacos are a bit on the meh side, but the burritos are good. On Wednesdays they're $6.50 (regularly $7.25), and if you're as broke as I usually am, every bit counts.
author: Paige C.

description: This place was not what I would expect from a Mexican Taqueria. I got the Super Carne Asada Burrito with shrimp but the order instead was changed to Carne Asada w/ more Carne Asada. I love beef as much as the next guy, but really? Even though they got the order wrong, I was okay with it. What I wasn't okay with was the fact that they put ground beef into the burrito! Carne Asada does not mean ground beef! I also ordered the regular nachos. It came cold, with unmelted shredded cheese and limp jalapenos, LIMP JALAPENOS!! How does that even happen?! The salsa that came with it taste more like tomato sauce with salsa. Overall, quite disappointing experience. I'd rather walk through the Broadway tunnel for Nick's Tacos instead.
author: Adelbert Y.

description: Reasonable if you're leaving a bar. I wouldn't go there for any other meal though, and really did you expect North Beach to be the spot for your burrito fix?
author: Misha T.

description: Awesome post-bars Mexican spot in North Beach if you're tired of the usual Chinese or pizza late night meal. I definitely recommend the Zorro - there are few California burritos (i.e. burrito with french fries in it...um, YUM?!) in the city that I know of! Service is pretty quick and the line usually isn't so bad. Kinda sucks that beans are an extra charge but at least the guac is free!
author: Tiffany F.

description:
My colleague recommended this place to me for my office party. I went in person to place the order and the taqueria was empty of customers. I have to admit I got a little nervous, but I relied on my recommendation and the 'best of SF guardian' they have listed on their website. 

I ordered grilled pollo and carnitas for taco buffet and the sides- beans, rice, salsas, guac. The ordering was a little challenging with the counter staff, but once I spoke with the manager he understood exactly what I wanted. Then the owner Norman followed up to make sure everything was perfect. 

I was really impressed with the food!! The flavors were delicious. I didn't get the 'meh' taco as one customer reviewed. It was really tasty and an inexpensive way to provide good easy food for a group meeting or holiday party. I will definitely order again. 

The only reason why it is 4 stars and not a 5 is I wish there was some cabbage or something fresh to put on top of the meat besides just the sauces. Regardless, my guests and I loved their food and there certainly weren't any complaints in the bunch.
author: Ginny B.

description:
Taqueria Zorro is the only Mexican place in North Beach, fortunately it's really good.

First of all; THEY HAVE LENGUA!!!

If you are not excited by that let me explain.  "Lengua' is "tongue", as in beef tongue.  If you think "ewe, gross!" to the idea of eating tongue than you have absolutely no right to even talk about food.  Lengua is incredible; it's moist, fatty, has a great texture, etc. etc.  You will not go back to carne asada, carnitas, or whatever else you usually get.  The lengua is fresh too!  How do I know?  They run out of it frequently but replenish their supply regularly.  I go regularly and they are out about a third of the time, if I go back the next day after they are out of it they usually have more!

They have daily specials: Monday is Quesadilla Day ($6.50 for any kind), Tuesday is Taco Day (tacos are cheaper but still too small to be worth it), Wednesday is Burrito Day (all burritos are $6.50, even wet super burittos!), and Thursday is Torta Day (get a free soda with your torta!).  Wednesday is the best special by far.

Their regular menu has most of the standards of a NorCal Mexican place.  Their burritos are really good, tacos not so much, quesadillas are not as good as the burritos but still good; the true gem, however, is their Taco Salad which is freaking awesome.

The taco salad comes in a big fried tortilla bowl filled with all kinds of goodness.  The bottom layer is a mix of your choice of meat, beans, and rice and it's covered with a very nice salad and usually topped with cheese.  Usually topped with cheese?  Yep, sometimes they forget and that inconsistency is where they loose a star.

If there's one problem with Zorro it's the inconsistancy; I've been charged different amounts for the same food on different days and each chef seems to do their own variation on each dish.  You never know exactly what you're getting but it's always good and always in the ballpark of what their menu claims.

Other problems?  A lot of the bums wander in here and try to take your food.  WTF?  If I wanted dirty hipster kids eying my food I'd eat in the Mission, NOT IN NORTH BEACH!
author: D D.

description:
Do you like cream?

Wednesdays are $6.50 burritos.
Ir's a good sized burrito with choice of grilled fish, green chile, pollo or carnias. 
Go for the Zorro, and you get fries and avo. choice of meat
In your burrito. 

Just delete the fries, go easy on the cream and have what i just had!!!
author: Bert K.

description: So sorry but the prawns burrito did not work for me.  Fusion is good if it works but I had to pick out the prawns and set them aside somewhere on a dish.  Yeah, it was deserted when I was there -- where everybody go?  Party of one is so boring.
author: BanBan T.

description: I walked past this place a few times and really wanted to try it.  The ambiance was very casual, with a big flat screen TV set up on the wall in the dining area.  I ordered a chicken super burrito.  My opinion is that it was just okay, nothing special.  The portions were also just okay, as was the service.  IMHO, the prices are slighty higher than they should be.  I give it a 2 and 1/2 stars.
author: Lawree S.

description: Teh food here was pretty good. I had the burrito and it was delicious. Great flavor. The fresh waters are also delicious. The melon flavor is worth trying. My only complain was that the restaurant looked dirty. That doesn't help when you're trying to enjoy a meal. They should try to keep up with the cleanliness of the restaurant.
author: Judith F.

description:
Steak Plate with re-fried beans

I ordered the "steak plate", It was very good. As you can see in the photo, it came with all the basics (beans, rice, lettuce, avocado, tomato, steak, and corn tortillas). The meat tasted great and was very tender. The sides were also very good. It was a very big plate of food.

 I will be returning and try something different.

If I have a negative comment, it is that for Mexican food and the ambiance, it was not inexpensive. However, this is probably due to the fact of being located on Columbus in the heart of North Beach.
author: Mark D.

description: Horrible experience.  The customer service is horrible.  The gal taking my order kept talking to another worker and looking away often while she took my order.  The bathroom was disgusting.  Paper, toilet paper and women hygiene stuff all over the floor.  Seems like the bathroom had not been cleaned in weeks.  So for the food, the tacos that both my wife and I bought were horrible. The meat was dry and the tortilla was hard.  We both almost barfed after eating.  Maybe it was a bad experience just for us as others have great reviews about this place (A gem ?) hardly....  but maybe others will have great food and customer service but then again, it's a taco place and maybe another day the food will be better.....
author: Sandy J.

description: I have been going here for over 10 years so I would say I'm a regular.  The food is great and I usually get the Super Taco. It's huge for the amount of money you pay. The Zoro Nachos made with French fries are awesome!  The negative is the service. The girls are hot and cold. One is so nice and friendly and the other is like a cold fish. The guys that cook are great and friendly.
author: Paul S.

description: I love the Zorro Burrito here. Conveniently located on Broadway and Columbus. The ladies on the cash counter looks serious with little or no smiles. The place is not so clean either. Cleanliness and Burrito joint don't go hand in hand, that's only my observation. Anyway, the food is great and the Chef is great. Don't know his name though.
author: Anand S.

description:
I would give this place 4 stars for the burrito, but I have to actually take one off for a few things:

1) we ordered a grilled chicken burrito and a grilled tofu burrito. We had to repeat it a few times, as the girl at the cash didn't seem to be able to understand us or register our order fast enough.

2) despite saying a few times what our order was, I wound up with a grilled veggie instead of tofu burrito. Eh, no big deal, I can still eat it, but it was still a mistake.

3) I requested my burrito as mild. Dunno how "burn your face off" qualifies as mild but it was definitely way above even medium level. The boy had hot salsa on his and he said it was pretty intense, so maybe mine really was "mild" on the scale of what they had.

The overall burrito was actually really great and I enjoyed all the veggies and the beans in it. I'd have given this place a 4 star definitely based on that, but the screwups deserve a ding and a mention.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I was dying for tacos and was super glad I found this place. I ordered the grilled fish and the al pastor tacos. Turns out they didn't have grilled fish, so I defected to getting the fried fish. 

So.. portion sizes are DINKY. I've never seen smaller tacos before. There was so little meat in them, and for the price they charge... 1 star. Otherwise I would've given two stars. I paid nearly ten dollars for something that barely filled me up. Flavor-wise, I've had better tacos. The sauce they put on each taco was pretty good though. 

The place itself is kinda diner-ish, though I'm okay with that.
author: Alessio Z.

description:
I try to stay away from the Mission for four reasons:

1) It smells weird.
2) Hipsters.
3) I'm from LA, and this ain't bomb-diggity Mexican food.
4) People always come up to me speaking Spanish.  I hate letting them down and seeing the look of disappointment on their faces when I tell them in broken Spanish that I no comprendo, no habla espanol.  Lo siento!

So, I opt for Taqueria Zorro, which is a few blocks away from my office.  Hoping to bank on some delicious crispy tacos, I was disheartened to find out that they didn't have any.  *SIGH*  To make matters worse, the lady behind the register spoke little English, so I was actually forced to use a bit of Spanish to communicate.

With my little spirits crushed, I decided to go for the Machaca con Huevos, which is basically a plate of deliciousness for less than $10.  Bits of fried meat (I'm guessing carne asada?), peppers and tomatoes were tossed in with scrambled eggs.  There were some breakfast potatoes in the middle (think country-style pieces seasoned with a salt and spice mixture).  Rice and beans (your choice of refried, pinto or black) with melted cheese on top.  Shredded lettuce with a big slice of tomato on top.  A stack of hot, soft tortillas.

The eggs were delicious - slightly spicy and seasoned so no salsa or pico was needed.  The rice and beans were also flavorful.  Salsa bar had awesome spicy green salsa.  Potatoes were better than your average breakfast joint.  No line at 12:15 PM.

One star off for slightly higher prices, no crunchy tacos, cash only, and a basket of chips cost $1.  My friend's enchiladas were deemed bland, so he had a blast finishing up my dish (and trust me, it's a HUGE platter).  Also, no tamales?  The selection is limited, so I'm guessing it's more of a burrito and taco place than a full-range Mexican place like El Sotano.

Mmmm, machaca con huevos, mi amor.
author: Tori S.

description: Great burrito for a quick fix! Open late and the food came out quick.
author: Marie W.

description:
what's better than a fish taco and carne asada taco after having drinks with friends?  KUNG FU TACOS!  ok, that was a shameless plug...  the tacos here are good and full of flavor, lots of meat and piled on with cilantro and onions.  definitely a satisfying late night snack.

I'm stuck here, whether to give them 3 or 4 stars.  I'm lowering it to 3 based on the cleanliness of the facility and their customer service.  I don't expect 5 star service from a taqueria but at least be helpful with the menu items... you know how they say it's clean enough to eat off the floor?  well, I wouldn't eat off their tables.  just be careful of where you put your food and your hands and always remember to wash your hands afterwards.  I guess I shouldn't be expecting too much here.  after all, this place is near the bars, clubs and strip clubs.
author: Samson M.

description:
Why this place only has 3.5 stars amazes me. it's so good. the zorro fries + carne asada= best carne asada fries ever............ I also had the burrito and it was huge and delicious, even when I was eating it cold and sober.

They also have an extensive salsa buffet. Get the green one!
author: Christina L.

description:
I love this place.  The first time I went here was in around 2003.  It was full of Mexican firefighters watching the Mexico vs USA soccer match.  Most rambunctious.  
The food is great.  I always get a burrito and a beer.  The burrito meat is always juicy and the tortilla is really nice too.  Not too pancake-like, but nothing like the crap you get in the supermarket.
The service is always great at the counter, which is incredible when you think of the mood they should be in considering they have to listen to that awful Chinese woman's singing.
I love their green salsa, but their red one, not so much!
Really good value with a Burrito around $7.  You get free chips if you want.
author: nottellinya a.

description:
Missionites will gasp at this statement, but I swear Taqueria Zorro in North Beach is the best taqueria in the city.

I love the salsa bar here (3 salsas of varying spiciness but uniform awesomeness) and the carne asada tacos. Normally I'm a taco supreme, give-me-all-the-toppings-and-condiments-you've-got kind of girl, but at this taqueria, the simple things are best. Fresh and delicious salsas and the plain ol' carne asada tacos. Extra cheap if you come on Taco Tuesday (every Tuesday!).
author: Kim T.

description: Overall two stars, bought nachos, tasted and smelled like urine. Starting trying to figure out why it smelled. Come to find out it was the sour cream that smell. Unknown if it was spoiled but...bad!!!!!!!!
author: Paris S.

description:
A few weeks ago, I was out drinking with friends and we turned to a usual North Beach drunchie staple, Golden Boy's. But another friend ventured down the street to Taqueria Zorro where he got a burrito which had fries in it. Fast forward a week later=me, drunk in a taxi by myself, telling myself "I will not drunk eat. I will not drunk eat." But the image of the burrito with fries popped into my head and I became convinced I must try it. So I told the taxi driver to instead stop along Columbus where I hopped out at Taqueria Zorro. 

After drunkenly scrutinizing the menu, I found the Zorro burrito with fries, sour cream and guacamole in it=JACKPOT! I carried the warm foil-wrapped goodie home, barely containing my excitement, got into my pajamas, turned off my lights and got in bed where I drunkenly consumed the burrito by the glow of my computer screen. 

It. Was. Delicious. Soft fries wrapped in a burrito with delicious meat, sour cream and guacamole. What's not to love? The meat is a tad too salty, but the rest of it makes up for it. One of those foods you can't help but close your eyes with pleasure while eating. Best burrito I've ever had, hands down. I'm pretty sure I was emitting moans and sighs of pleasure. If my roommates had been home, they probably would've thought I was engaging in inappropriate activities. But well, some girls bring home boys. I bring home burritos. 

I'm pretty sure this new discovery will be pretty hazardous to my waistline, especially with it being just a 5 minute walk from my apartment, but I wouldn't have it any either way! Next time you're drunk in North Beach, get the Zorro burrito. You won't regret it. Even if you wake up with salsa-stained sheets. ;)
author: Steffi L.

description: This is definitely a hole in the wall place which seems to be the earmark of authentic Mexican food. I ordered a carne asada torta also known as a mexican steak sandwich with a side of fries. It was definitely a two hand sandwich and was jam packed with all the goodies! I tried the house salsa which was just the right amount of spicy for me. Authentic mexican food is simply the best.
author: Faith C.

description: Yum! Most of the options in the area are centered around Italian food, but I simply cannot do without a Mexican option like this. I believe it is the zorro burrito that has fries in it, which you'd have to be a fool not to want. A great late night or really anytime option for fast casual!
author: Melissa R.

description: went here because I am local.  burrito good sometime but one day I walk home and I finish burrito make me go diarrhea. shit out 8 dollars. also very messy to clean
author: Jon S.

description: Pretty yummy. Got a veggie burrito with extra picco de gallo. I would say I didn't get any extra and was disappointed in the amount of veggies in my veggie burrito. Not enough lettuce. The rice was bland but everything else had a good smokey flavor to it.  i wouldn't mind having it again.
author: Katie B.

description: Don't get the Zorro Nachos. I was feeling adventurous and only finished one third of them. They were okay but I was expecting fries as one of my toppings on the Nachos, instead it was just fries with all the regular nacho toppings. My friend got the cheese quesadilla, which was really good. Tip: Don't be adventurous at this place and you're food will be pretty good.
author: Iman R.

description: I was wandering on Columbus when I bumped into this gem. Its hard find good mexican food in this part of town but Zorro does not disappoint. The service is fast and the food came hot and fresh. I will soon become a regular.
author: Helen L.

description:
On our way back to our hotel, we decided to walk around North Beach. I've never been there before so my girlfriend was showing me around. As I walked by this restaurant, I suddenly wanted some Mexican food. The food wasn't anything special, but the portions were very generous. We just ordered a couple of tacos each, and there was so much meat that you couldn't even pinch the ends of the tortillas together. Personally, that's a little too much meat for me. 

Not sure if I'd stop by again since it's in an Italian neighborhood, but one never knows.
author: Michael C.

description:
I stopped here for a quick lunch. A few tacos and we'd be on our way.  I had a few tacos and my girlfriend had a veggie burrito.  Everything was actually pretty tasty!  The salsa selection was good and the ingredients were all fresh and well proportioned.  

This isn't high dining but it is really good, fast food.  Recommended if you're in the area and want to stop in and have a quick bite to eat.

The staff was very nice and the place was generally clean and pleasant.
author: John G.

description:
This spot should have been featured on Unsolved Mysteries..why, do you ask? The mystery is how this place has managed to stay in business for several years. The only thing this place is good at serving up is diarrheria! 

I get it. This place specializes in serving cheap food to intoxicated North Beach visitors. As a person who has lived in North Beach, and will be moving back soon, I can honestly say that I've given this place plenty of chances. I tried this place during the day, at night, during the week, and on the weekends. Each time I astonished at how bad the food was. All of the ingredients taste like they came out of an old can. The decor - cheesy and unauthentic. And the service - was on par with the type of service you get from a fast food restaurant. 

Please heed my warning. The next time you're thinking about stopping by here, do yourself a favor and go lick the stripper pole at Little Darlings next door. I'm sure you'll find the taste more appealing than anything Zorro could produce, and there's less of a chance of  "catching something."
author: Michael H.

description:
First off, I'm from San Diego.  I had much pride in the California burrito from my hometown, but as fate would have it, I drunkenly stumbled into this place while I was visiting some friends in SF.  Much to my surprise, I saw the California burrito on the menu and I thought to myself, "there's no way this is the same burrito as the one from SD.  AND there's absolutely no way it'll taste nearly as good."  But I had to try it, so I ordered one.

Well, after what seemed like a long & arduous wait for my drunchies to arrive (frankly, it was probably only about 4 or 5 minutes), the burrito finally came.  Tearing through the layers of aluminum foil, my heart was beating insanely fast... most likely because I had way too much to drink and I get massive Asian glow.  Anyway, I finally got past the aluminum foil to the warm tortilla, and I poured a little bit of the green sauce on top before biting down.  

HOLY FLAVOR EXPLOSION BATMAN!  I hadn't had a burrito this good... ever!  I didn't believe it.  So I took another bite, and another.  And my friends ate some too.  Then they kept eating more.  Everyone was stunned.  Shocked.  Flabbergasted.  We couldn't believe just how amazingly delicious this burrito was!
