The next day, we were still thinking about the burrito.  We decided that there was no way a California burrito in SF could be better than one in SD, so we went back again... completely sober.  This burrito had high expectations to live up to.

And did it ever.  Wow.  The second time was just as good as the first!  I now have a new favorite burrito place.  Unfortunately, it's 500 miles away.
author: Yu T.

description: I'm a huge fan of tacos, so this place came in handy. Open fairly late and friendly service. Now for the food. I ordered take out, 1 grilled fish and 1 prawn taco with chips. Flavor feel flat, no seasoning, just plain ole dry...but it was plenty of shrimp and fish in the soggy taco.  The chips tasted stale and the salsa a bit watery.  Cool if you just need a little something to eat.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Worst FOOD POISONING experience I've had in my entire life :( 

The food was complete crap, but the service was very good. They brought me my food and gave me free chips and water. Sweet people, it's quite a shame that they aren't using fresh food :(
author: Lori L.

description:
We were downtown and didn't want to ride all the way out to Mission, so I looked on yelp for what's local and found this little place.  Apparently, it's in little italy area of SF, the area was very nice and fun to walk around, but this actual taqueria was not good!

The food was expensive for a Taqueria, my burrito and drink cost me 12.50. I got the carne asada and there were no actual pieces of steak, it was just shredded steak, almost like you'd find in a taco.  Yuck ...

The rice had a minty taste, I LOVE burritos, but this one tasted so bad, i actually had to stop eating it.

I'm not a particularly picky eater, either!
author: Jared C.

description: This was was only taqueria in the area when I lived in Russian Hill years ago.  I would stop in for late night nachos.  They weren't the best but satisfied my crave.
author: Brent F.

description:
Not the best place for a veggie burrito.  Small and expensive.  Better off waiting till you get to the Mission.

Burritos are roughly $7.   

The salsa is good though.
author: Bucky W.

description: Both times I've gone, I specifically requested mild salsa. Both times I got my burrito, it's been inedibly spicy. I'm so done with this place. I'm out $8 and still haven't been able to eat lunch.
author: Katie H.

description: It may be a bit lack luster on the inside but just get the bbq pork super quesadilla and all will be right in the world!!!
author: Amy E.

description:
$8 - something for a burrito?....sure, why not?

Going fancy on something like burritos isn't usually my style, but this place gets me to do it every time. I've tried a couple different burritos from here, and it sounds weird, but the breakfast burrito is my favorite. It's like one of those SoCal burritos with fries in it, but it has eggs in it, and it's especially delicious after 9pm. Fucking delicious. The mushroom quesadilla is good too, and everything here is HUGE. 

The service is good; I've never had to wait too long for my food. They also have a great selection of salsas in their salsa bar in the back. 

I really don't know what else to say about this place except...luxury burritos! (at least compared to what I'm used to).
author: Angela S.

description:
Hey, what happened to this place?  And, who was that guy who hugged me when I entered the Taqueria?

How long has it been Taqueria Zorro?  Remember the nights you use to fill my stomach contently before those inebriated times of chaos, lust, loathing, love, and debauchery.  Oh, how I've missed you!  But what happened to you.  Was I so naive when I was younger that I thought you were the 'shizzle for my stizzle'.

I guess, times do change, so we must change with the times.  I must move on my friend.  I have experienced a world of Taquerias out in the world now and realized that my youth was a mere vessel to lead me to greater heights in the burrito world.
author: Jules S.

description: I ate here every night for a long time because they were selling me a tostada for less than 5$ that was like a crunchy tortilla circle covered with piles of beans, cheese, lettuce and a ton of meat. The bar-b-que pork is the bomb, but I noticed I was getting hell of fat from something at Zorro. Maybe it was the pork or MSG, I really doubt anybody knows. The guys who work here are hell of cool, proud guys and there sometimes are cool ladies at the register. It doesn't happen a lot, but there are sometimes perfect 10 strippers on line at this place. There also sometimes are a lot of cops in here. ;)
author: Avram K.

description: The biggest mistake I stumbled upon in a while. This place is so over priced, food is bland and not spicy. I felt violated after eating here it was really bad.... oh and to top it off $10 for two tacos and a soda....If you think this is good perhaps you dont travel in SF much... plenty of killer places in S.SF that have better flavor a nice kick and cheaper for sure... shame on them for even calling this Mexican food !
author: Kent S.

description:
I recently went here on a rainy day mainly to get out of the down poor before catching the bus. The sign out front is very catchy but the flavor is not. I had a grilled chicken burrito with everything on it but for the price and lack of defined flavors the only thing good about this place is that it keeps you dry when it's raining. 

In a city with hundreds of amazing taquerias this place has a long way to go so for now they are definitely off the list because being only decent doesn't cut it.
author: Justin S.

description: This place is great and tasty! Had two Al Pastor (bbq pork) tacos that were delicious, and a cold Dos XX beer, can't beat it.Totally recommend this place.
author: Stephanie E.

description:
This is good for late night after a night of drinking. The food is okay but nothing to be taken aback.

I was with one of my buddies for a night out of town and this place was conveniently open so I said why not. I had no expectations anyways.

I do like the ambiance. The mariyachi (sp) was blasting and some couples were even dancing by the tables. Pretty entertaining nonetheless.

The food itself was okay. I ordered a chicken burrito and i've had tons of them in my lifetime. The chicken had good flavor but the problem was for one, the salsa they put in was very spicy. I can take it but that night I had been drinking and the last time I wanted was spicy food! There were too many juices which result in the tortilla to get soggy towards the middle to end of the burrito. And three, the burrito is wrapped with like 5 layers of tin foil! Maybe it's b/c of the extra juices!

Overall, it's average at best. A late night spot to get some quick food. That's about it.
author: James K.

description:
Dude, get the super mojado burrito. Its got enchilada sauce all over it, guacamole, sour cream and melted warm cheese on top too. You are going to want to rub this burrito all over your body. But you won't do that because you are hungry. Maybe order two and rub one on your body and eat the other. 

I came here hung over Monday morning and ordered this with the carne asada inside. I thought they were a little skimpy on the guacamole but other than that I have no complaints. I love burritos. A good burrito gets me aroused. This burrito aroused me. All the stuff inside of it was mixed well. The enchilada sauce made me want to lick my plate. 

My friend ordered the super mojado burrito with shrimp and surprisingly, they were really generous with the shrimp! You know how most places are skimpy with the shrimp? Yeah, not this place. Lots of large, yummy shrimp in his burrito. My other friend had chorizo and eggs with beans and his portion was very large. The prices are pretty standard Taqueria prices. I thought our food was worth every dollar. 

Oh, and they have a little salsa bar with a few different kinds. I really liked their salsa. I'm a baby and can't eat super spicy stuff and they had a salsa that was chunky and yummy and not too spicy. 

If you're in the North Beach area and are craving Mexican food, I would say Zorro is the place to go!
author: Liz M.

description: Staff is dumb , had no idea how to redeem a voucher from restaunt. Com . Completely disappointed . Manegment should work on this , you stand to lose more customers like me . Get your employees trained on Groupon . To improve your business
author: Henry S.

description: Got the veggie burrito. Tortilla was cold (I like mine warm), and there was more lettuce than beans/cheese/rice. I guess that's why it's "veggie," but all the good stuff (beans/cheese/rice) were in smaller quantities. Flavour was sort of lacking... because of all the lettuce, it tasted more watery and not savoury. Not great for the price ($7 or so).
author: Dan Y.

description: i feel like ive been scammed. i ordered the fish taco & its not even worth $6. the girl in the cashier was rude also & didnt greet me. the workers that were cooking did not wash tgeir hands when comming back but instead just dipped their hands into the ice. disgusting !!!
author: Kyln L.

description:
I'm writing this review based on one experience and one item. 

I went to college in San Diego and spent 5 years there. In that time, I fell in love with something called a "California burrito." It generally has carne asada, pico de gallo, cheese, sour cream, guacamole and french fries. 

It may sound odd to some who have never tried it - but it's delicious in a way that's nearly indescribable. 

No where in San Francisco does it anywhere close to what it tastes like in San Diego. I've tried at several locations and it just doesn't work. 

So tonight when I was leaving North Beach and my buddy told me about this place that had a California burrito, I said I'd be down to try it. 

It's amazing. 

Completely and absolutely amazing. 

It's the closest thing to a San Diego style California burrito I've ever tasted up here. The carne was done right. The fries were done right. The tortilla was the right size.  

If you are a San Diego transplant or a returning San Franciscan from San Diego and have been craving a California burrito (like I had been, desperately), come here. It does it 100% right.
author: Jeff T.

description: This is my favorite Mexican North of the Mission. Located in the heart of North Beach, TZ has everything you want from Mexican- Tasty Salsa bar, Warm fresh chips, a classic california-mex menu, nacho fries! and they will talk you through your order as they cook it. Bomb.
author: Chris S.

description:
Its no wonder they don't have many Mexican restaurants in North Beach. Its called little Italy for a reason. 

I went with a group to track down a good breakfast burrito to soak up some of the drinks i had the night before. 

I got a carne asada burrito for almost $8 and a few others got some regular burritos. 

First of all the service wasn't that great. I felt like I was going to be put in detention if I asked for water one more time. And the salsa isn't accesible...you have to ask for it. :(My breakfast burrito was hardly mediocre. It was a bunch of rice and it looked like ground chorizo instead of carne asada like I had hoped. I don't know. I'd rather go to Mama's down the street instead. 

My recommendation: Do not get Mexican food or breakfast burritos in North Beach.
author: Heather H.

description:
The burritos here can get pricey but on weds burritos r 6 bucks.

I usually get the super chicken with no cheese it's huge and very consistent.

Also remember to use the green sauce ...
author: DOM d.

description:
Missed the mark.

No egg whites.

No wheat tortillas.

Not cheap.

No lack of oil in the chicken.

Hoped for a little more "yes" with my $7 breakfast burrito.

They probably hope most of us would say "yes" in coming back.

Both of us missed the mark.
author: Jason B.

description: Come on  Tuesday for $2.25 tacos or Wednesday for burrito special,  except for shrimp.  Small serving of chips, salsa on ice.  Order was easy, 5 min wait for food.   None of the meats stood out.  It's just a taqueria in North Beach that has horchata.
author: Rey D.

description:
I love their burrito.. there was one there that i really like. instead of putting rice on the center of the burrito, they use fries. yum!
they serve the food to your table when you dine in so you dont have to wait on the front.
author: Wendy Z.

description:
I came here late at night with a friend after drinking (considering the restaurant's location near strip clubs and bars this is the number one way to enjoy it because it is open so late). I got the California Burrito which doesn't appear on the online menu but was directly under the Zorro Burrito on the menu. 

The burrito was very saucy which I generally enjoy even though it makes quite a mess. It was decently priced and not small but not particularly large (in a world of mega-sized burritos). I have gone other times and gotten other things but that is the best they serve and it is very good.
author: Stephen S.

description:
I asked them not to add any sauce on top of my burrito but on the side, but they didn't.
inside the burrito (Mojado) was too dry. I had to add more sauce and sour cream to be able to swallow it. 
they have 4,5 different types of sauce: 2 red ones are absolutely tasteless. green sauce and tomato sauce are at least hot!
fish taco was soooo bland.
author: Neda M.

description:
Pretty good taqueria in an area where one wouldn't otherwise expect to see a cheap mexican joint.
I had their veggie tacos which were pretty good, except that they were wayy too filled too loaded up to picked up and eaten like normal tacos.. I tried eating them with a fork and knife which turned out be an exercise in futility.. so this made for very messy eating.
Their salsas were a lot thicker and yummier than most other places, and they have nice big seating area with a tv.
author: Aditya M.

description: Stopped here for a quick bite while exploring the area. The quesadilla was alright and not that cheap. You can tell they're trying to make it cozy. What repulsed me was the bathroom. I just didn't feel like they care very much about hygiene which is an unpleasant thought.
author: Yolanda Y.

description: This place is pretty horrible. It is a cheap taqueria with few redeeming qualities.
author: Melville M.

description:
Wow, this is the second Taqueria in the Bay Area that I noticed had alcohol. It seems like it's pretty much the norm to have alcohol with tacos in Northern California. I've been to numerous places in Southern California, and you'll be lucky to have alcohol being served, but, I digress.

For those that know me, know that I have a weird fetish when it comes to tacos. Issues would be more like it. My friends and I normally end a meal with tacos as dessert (oh so healthy). So, I would say, I know a good taco when I commence grubbage on one.

So, before dinner, as we were walking around, we stumbled upon this tacqueria. Futbol (soccer) was on the tube. Posters of Futbol teams everywhere and alcohol! I ordered two Carne Asada tacos, which were decent. Seasoned OK, but just didn't have that flavor that normally puts my mind into a euphoric state that good Carne Asada does. I loved my trip to the bay, but I was starting to miss Mexican food from Southern California.
author: Wes S.

description:
Pay no mind to the "Bathroom out of service" sign.  As long as you're a paying customer, you should have no problem obataining a bathroom key from the cashier. 

Okay. And now onto the food. Since this seems to be the only Mexican place in North Beach, I have dined here on several occasions - usually after too much pizza and meatball sandwiches. 
Sometimes a cheap little taco, on the way to walking to the parking garage, is in order. 

Their super burritos and carnitas tacos are my standard grub.  The carnitas are just the right amount of moist with some crispy bits.  The super burrito is a messy grub-fest, so be sure to grab a fork.  The have a couple of salsas (a guacamole-based, and semi-spicy red one, some pico de gallo, some marinated jalapenos, and some sliced lime).  Chips are an extra buck, so make sure to ask for them while ordering your main meal.

All in all, this is a decent, quick, tasty place to get some Mexican (no, not him - I dine on him later) in the heart of all that is Italian/Asian fare.
author: Kara B.

description:
i know i shouldn't compare Taqueria Zorro with the taquerias in Mission but i have to. The prices for a burrito is kinda expensive -- a regular burrito is 5.95 and a SUPER burrito is 9.95! plus chips AREN'T for free?! its an additional $1 for chips. 

but i know its the only taqueria in north beach and its a great location for drunkards that have the munchies after clubbing on Broadway. 

PRO: fresh and good location
CON: prices and no free chips :(

but i wont be coming back.

MISSION BURRITOS ARE LOVEEEE
author: Carol Y.

description:
I have to say, the goods within the burrito are pretty top notch, but the problem is all in the execution. There is a general sense of DGAF about proportion and ratio of rice, beans, meat to the size of the tortilla for the result to be stellar. By the last dollop of guacamole, you already know there's a lot of love - almost too much love to wrap and you're thinking, "There's no way he can make this work; there's so much food and not much tortilla!" And your thoughts are spot on. The guy folds one part of the tortilla over, realizes he can't complete the job right, and literally uses the foil to smush everything together and hold it tight. This happens every time. 

And personally, I really enjoy Gordo's burritos and really appreciate them even more every time I visit TZ. Why? Well, Gordo's puts cheese on the tortilla when they heat the tortilla so it melts nicely. TZ heats the tortilla, adds all the other stuff, then the cheese, smushes the burrito, and then heats it again the steamer. The cheese is still not melted and then it just tastes weird. 

It always feels a little dirty sitting inside, but when you're in the mood for a burrito, you just have to eat it right away. Unfortunately, there aren't any other burrito places nearby, so TZ has to do.
author: NickJess S.

description:
Went to Zorro with a daily deal coupon for $10 worth of food. I got a regular chicken burrito and chips. They have a salsa bar with two types of salsa. When I opened the burrito wrapper, the actual burrito was like soggy & wet probably due to the salsa inside the burrito. The chicken was pulled chicken and the burrito was OK. The chips were MAYBE 10 chips in a ilttle bag. 

I probably won't return...
author: Heather M.

description:
$1.75 taco Tuesdays and $6 burrito Wednesdays, eh. I come here only because they're right around the corner from where I live and is actually the least sketchiest cheap restaurant along the walk. They have pretty fast service, too, which is a plus when I'm not expecting anything exceptional.

I have gotten their tostadas, tortas, burritos, and tacos. Out of these, I'd just stick with the tacos for their utility, and maaaybe the tostadas, except the lettuce and tomato they put on my recent ones have been questionable. Their carne asada comes out very dry, but I guess it's not that bad if you must have your beef. If I had to choose a meat to get, I'd go with the chicken or pastor. Their chorizo and lengua aren't that bad, either. I've had pretty bad chicken at Mexican restaurants, but Zorro's chicken is actually decent, flavorful, and not dry. Their pastor isn't as juicy as I've had them, but it still tastes nice. I'd skip on their other pork options; I'm not very fond of how they do carnitas or chile verde. I could also do without the salsa they add in a container for their tacos.

But anyways! Taqueria Zorro is a chill place to go on Tuesdays or Wednesdays for the deal to get full! If I had more money, I'd probably opt for the other places surrounding it, though.
author: Amy Y.

description:
The day after NYE, we wandered around the streets of north beach looking for something to help ease our hangovers. We tried going to another mexican place--something maybe fusion, overly americanized and fancy--but they were packed and the host was being snooty about the 2 hour wait time. I'm willing to wait for good food but if you're gonna turn up your nose and act like you're the shit, I'll pass. It's just annoying.

So we wandered around some more and found Taqueria Zorro and decided to try it. He got a giant monster burrito and I got a quesadilla the size of my head. They were both super cheesy and delicious and put us in a major food coma. 

Best ever.
author: Ringo M.

description: $six zorro burrito....avocado, sour cream, al pastor for meat selection y fries...all rolled up in a large flour tortilla and foil wrapped burrito...super large and duper filling...a burrito with no rice y no beans...perfect for a deep socal burrito lover at heart....please note that zorro goes heavy duty on the sour cream...on the side next time...also note that zorro also offers a typical norcal bean, rice and vegetable useless filler filled mega-burritos...
author: Hen A.

description: Came here for the Zorro burrito after my brother raved about french fries. To be honest, I think I would have preferred rice and beans - french fries tend to get a bit wet in a burrito, I've noticed, though that could partly be because we walked up to Chinatown before we finally sat down to eat. Still, they gave me carnitas and shrimp in the SAME BURRITO, so how can I really complain? Salsas are great, too.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Working the night shift really wasn't cool because pretty much everything was closed.. my co-worker told me about this place and how they are open late and is pretty good on price..

Well the price is good ... but when it came to the food... that's another story.. 

I ordered a veggie taco from here and when I started eating it.. it was ok but I had an extra surprise in my taco.. I was eating and bit into a pea... which really threw me off.. also found a few more peas and carrots in the taco too.. I don't know about you but I'm pretty sure your not suppose to put peas and carrots inside a taco.. 

Good thing they gave me chips and salsa to get the taste of the taco out of my mouth...
author: Lena S.

description: You know .. I dont know how I end up here. Somehow I get talked into this place, and this place have nothing on my usual taco joint. However, I do appreciate taco tuesday deals and the fact that it never gets too crowded. Also, the service is decent and the food aint bad, but you know. I've had better. Much much better.
author: Jessica H.

description: Considering the location, in the midst of strip clubs, Italian restaurants and on the edge of Chinatown, Zorro is surprisingly good. It's slightly pricier than, say, someplace in the Mission, but I would attribute that to the high rent I'm guessing they have to pay. I'm a burrito and quesadilla kinda guy and Zorro always hits the spot for me. I have a buddy who is way pickier than I am and he says they're good as well. My favorite bar is Vesuvio (which is across the street), so when I go there, I'm usually coming here before or after drinks. No complaints at all.
author: J N.

description:
I am so addicted to this place now. Just went and got 4 fish tacos. Less than $7. I'm a pig, but a cheap pig!!! 
Eat it up!!!

Also, why no salsa bar anymore????

PPS, Why so much packaging for to-go orders????
author: joanna r.

description:
I have found the third burrito.

Everything good comes in threes right?  Or is that everything bad?  Either way...

It started with the Papalote Soyrizo Burrito.  Mmm, so tasty.

Next was the Little Chihuahua tofu burrito.  The real great thing about the LC are their salsa choices.  I recommend Chipotle!

But enough about those guys, they're old hat!  Chime Taqueria Zorro and their delicious Zorro burrito!  Gaucamole, sour cream, french fries, and all the other fixin's you'd expect make a stellar burrito.

Oddly, chips are free with to-go orders but not dine-in.

Open late!  Cash only!  Awesome burritos!
author: Jeff G.

description:
Really good, cheap burritos outside of the Mission. Their non-meat options extend beyond beans and rice in a tortilla. The grilled vegetable burrito comes with grilled peppers and onions. I don't eat starches, so I ordered it without rice, cut it open, doused it in free salsa and fresh lime juice, and ate the insides. It was delicious.

I asked for cheese, which didn't come with the burrito, but the cashier was nice enough to simply ring it up as a substitution since I didn't want rice, rather than charging me extra.
author: Holly U.

description:
I probably go here 2-3 times a month since it is 1 of 2 burrito shops in North Beach.  The burritos are delicious and pretty big.  It's a little expensive, but not horrible.  The indoor seating is kind of a dump.  The salsas are just ok.  I wish they had a bigger selection of condiments.  The breakfast burritos are interesting.  They're pretty much regular burritos with french fries in them.  
On a bright side, the quesadillas are amazing.
On a side note, it's located  right next to a strip club.  If you don't mind being harassed by the strip club doormen every time you get a buritto, this place may work for you.
author: Robert S.

description: How do you say "barely adequate to sustain life" in Español? Because that's what these nachos were.
author: Kevin U.

description:
3.5 stars is about right.  

This place just can't touch El Faralito. 

What it did well: flavorful meat. Good tortilla. Large size. 

The bad: Poor burrito roll technique, overfilled with sour cream, internal cheese not melted, multiple gross gristly chunks of meat, and they are salsa nazis.  

Biggest gripe: 8.15+ tax for a super burrito, you can get a burrito and a taco for that much at el faralito.  Moreover, the whole salsa behind the counter thing is lame.  Also, the salsa they had were not that good.  Pico was watery and bland and the green isn't anything special. 

Ok for the area and for a late night bite, but not very high on the overall burrito meter.
author: Mike I.

description:
Came here on Taco Tuesday...man, how I wish I had known about this special before my last week at work!

All tacos are only $1.50...yes, you read that correctly.  I had fish tacos which combined cost less than one order under the normal pricing.  They were small, but pretty filling.  The fish can either be grilled or fried - I had the grilled fish which was a generous size and juicy.  It comes with red onions, red cabbage and some sauce.  

The food was a bit salty and the chips in particular were extremely salty...but for $1.50 tacos and a bag of chips, I'm not one to complain!
author: Alvina W.

description:
I liked you better, when Taco Tuesday was just $1 per Taco, you killed it for me when you went to $1.50..Shame on you ZORRO :). 
Overall nice place to grab a quick bite, Always a football match to watch in the back room. 
CASH ONLY - NO Credit Cards
author: Séamus C.

description:
Fantastic surprise at this place.  We are not from this area & have been trying new places all week. Some have been good, some bad.  
  The prawn quesidilla was a great deal and very filling.  The steak burrito majado was amazing.  In an area with tons of restaurants, this one has been our favorite by far.  Food tasted fresh and was still hot when we took it home.
author: Chris F.

description:
Never hurts to have one Mexican choice in the heart of North Beach.  We checked this out because we had a GroupOn.  Hubby chose their nachos with chorizo.  The plate was piled high and he managed to plow through about half of it before asking for a to-go container.  I picked a Carnitas-filled cheese quesadilla and WOW!  The plate weighed like 5 pounds and was heaping with quesadilla goodness.  Carnitas were nicely flavored with good balance of soft, chewy and crispy.  Cheese was gooey and plentiful.  Accompanying pico de gallo & roasted chilies gave it just the right kick.

For the price, a satisfying decent meal.
author: Lxs S.

description:
Whoa!

Not quite what I expected in North Beach, but after wandering around SF all day I was really hankering for some carne asada! Got two tacos and wow they REALLY pile the meat on! I love when the meat is little crumbles, so they did a good job there. The only thing I would have liked would have been a little more onion/cilantro to go with all that meat.

Sucks that they don't give drink refills, but at least they're up front about it.
author: Torie Y.

description:
OK, so I've eaten here a few more times since I wrote that last review, without any alcohol affecting my judgment, and it deserves an extra star. Chile Relleno burrito is aaaaaaaamazing.

I just wish I didn't have to walk by the strip clubs to get to it!
author: Christine K.

description: Love this place. Their spicy chicken tacos are amazing. I look forward to Tuesdays just to take advantage of their taco Tuesday deals! Also, their grilled fish is so good (when they have it). The Zorro burrito too..fries instead of beans? Yes please! I could go on and on. One more: their salsa!! Only a few kinds, but I practically drink it it's so good and fresh. As is their spicy carrots. Can't wait for tomorrow:) It's a quick and casual place, but clean and gets the job done.
author: Misty M.

description: Zorro burrito is the bomb. Love the fries replacement of the beans and very thin ( not doughy ) tortilla which makes the burrito much less heavy.  Great for the price. Def a try! The place does need some renovating and it can be kept cleaner.
author: Carrie T.

description:
Update 3-15: I went back! and Yes this was the spot! DO watch out for those carrots! They are fire!

I was drunk and hyphy. I still need to figure out if this was the place we went to for burritos. All I remember is wanting a hotdog. After the last yelp party, we came back to North Beach and had dogs in a counter service like spot. This time our only choice was burritos. We walk in, wait in line for 10 minutes (it was packed) and we get 2 big super burritos. Carne Asada Meat was good, filling was perfect. Share these bad boys! You won't be able to finish one alone. 

All I remember is how GOOOD they were. I ate like 3/4 and tossed my BF the rest. Poor guy. He was the DD and all he got was a bitten up burrito. I must come back during the day and confirm this was the spot. You know how it is when youre buzzing, hungry and want to attack something greasy.
author: Lily M.

description: French fries in a burrito ? Why no! I absolutely loved that place when my friends introduced to me!
author: Khaloud D.

description: I usually get the burritos here and they are pretty damn good. I like the various specials that they offer throughout the week. Zorro burrito is akin to a California burrito and quite good if you are not being health conscious.
author: Andrew H.

description:
We have just recently moved back to the North Beach area and I was wondering if El Zoro's food would be as good as I remembered it to be. Sure enough, it is!

This place is open late, the food is very, very good and it's reasonably priced. Now, this is definitely a take-out place  and not a nice sit-down restaurant , which is exactly what one should expect from a Taqueria. And, the fact that it's next door to a strip club really has no bearings on how good their food is. I just wish that they had a delivery service!
author: Mia S.

description:
I was wondering around the area looking for something to munch on early mornin and found a good amount places closed around 10 -11 am.  I really wasn't even in the mood for mexican food.  After wondering around long enough I saw that this place was open and I said "Fuck it, it's go time".

I went for two tacos, simple.  I wasn't after anything extravagant.  Just wanted something to throw in the ol' gas tank so I can move.  I got a carnitas taco and a carne asada taco.  I sat  and fumbled around with my phone for a few minutes.  My tacos were then handed to me.

They were delicious.  So much meat and stuff. They do the double corm tortilla thing, which usually I hate, but in this case, it wasn't even enough for all that succulent meat.  I'd probably go again, if given the opportunity.  Of course, there's just so many restaurants in San Fran, it's going to have to wait till I get a few more cranked out.

Boner Apple Tits.
author: Jorge R.

description:
Taco Tuesdays are awesome but only for meat. If you don't want meat, you have to pay full price. That sucks.

You can get a six pack of Coronas for $10 every day and the restaurant area in the back is okay. Expect to wait about ten minutes for even the simplest of orders. However the burrito I ordered was HUGE and wrapped in copious amounts of tin foil to keep it warm just in case I was walking to Oakland with it.
author: Alex R.

description: You ask for mild salsa on your burrito and they give you the spicy house salsa. They don't care. I am writing this review to help remind myself to never go back there.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I was surprised to find a decent veggie burrito joint here next to all the strip clubs...but I guess it makes sense. 
It was big, it was tasty and it was cheap.
All you could want in a burrito.
I am satisfied.
author: Kelley D.

description:
It looks authentic so why doesn't it taste it?  Alright, I'm not Mexican BUT I've eaten my fair share while going to Mission High and working in the Potrero area, as well as the many joints in San Jose.

Yes, the price is high but considering the location - it's cool.  It's ok at best.  The sad thing is it wasn't even hot - how's that even possible?

If you have cravings for Mexican in the wee hours and stuck in the North Beach area, this is the place for you.  I think they have a bucket of beer for $9.99 so that is a good deal...so what it's Corona?
author: Gloria H.

description:
I had a carnita burrito, with sour cream and avocado and a coke for about 8$. 
The burrito was huge and it tasted good, had horrible heart burn after, but that's not their fault. right?!
author: Alisson X.

description: This place has consistently won me over for authentic mexican food. I've tried several other spots in the mission and none have sufficed in flavor or quality. Most days I get something basic like a carne asada burrito, chips and maybe a soda. Averaged priced, and usually your order is up in 5-10m tops.
author: J K.

description:
They are losing a star....for upping the price of taco tuesday tacos.

Yea yea, 50 cents isn't that bad... but eff, I was used to dollar tacos.

This economy just blows...
author: David H.

description: I've been here twice. The first time I would have given 2 stars, the second time 1 star. I'll round up from 1.5 to 2, for convenience and a decent taco (carnitas) the first time I ate here. Tried the chile verde the last time, which was almost inedible due to the amount of fat and almost no pork. Literally, I had at least a softball size glob of fat, and many smaller pieces of pure fat, covered in chile verde sauce, and at most, 1 full bite of actual pork. This was also advertised as a special of the day on their sidewalk sign, so I would expect it to be better prepared. At $10, it was quite a rip off, since I ended up paying for rice, beans, and iceberg lettuce. Too many options in the area, so I won't be coming back.
author: Alison S.

description: I love their grillled veggie burrito, it's superb.  My favorite burrito in the city.  Salsa bar is also fantastic.  However, the bathroom is gnarly.
author: Keegan R.

description:
Pretty good burritos, certainly by most standards, though probably only meh by Mission standards.

I've had the chicken one and the carnitas.  Meat was good quality in both cases, a bit too much rice for my tastes and the salsa was inconsistent on two consecutive days - yesterday it was bland, today more flavorful, but still not spicy enough for me.
author: Brian G.

description:
I am kind of a Burrito super fan and this place was just enough to somewhat satisfy my craving.  They immediately lost points when I ordered Carnitas and they told me they were out.  The Carne Asada was descent at best and there just wasn't anything that really differentiated this place from any run of the mill burrito spot.

Huge positive for these guys, they are open late night, and a burrito at 2AM after a sweaty dance fest at Kells is the ticket to eliminating the morning after hangover!
author: Ken V.

description: I came here twice. The first time, I loved what I got (I think it was an enchilada-burrito type thing). Not so much the second time (flautas). Their salsa though is AMAZING. I loved it. Overall it's a great Mexican place with tons of flavor.
author: Jay M.

description:
Food is all right, pretty average.  

Main reason this place gets 3 stars is that I called ahead, placed an order and they told me the food would be ready in 10 minutes.  I get there about 15 minutes later and that is when they BEGIN making my order.  They hadn't even started yet and the place was empty when I walked in so it's not like they were super busy.  3 stars for laziness.
author: G. T.

description:
We live in the neighborhood and love this place. Taco Tuesday with great fish taco's from $3.95 for $1.50 and on Burrito Wednesday a great (any kind) of burrito for only $6.00

They have some great fried fish or meat specials also, lots of food for a small price. 

And where can you watch soccer almost any time while having a great meal?
author: The A.

description: Probably my favorite Mexican food place, I get the chicken quesadilla everytime and it's so huge. My boyfriend can't even finish the burrito. Definitely bang for your buck.
author: Allison M.

description:
I'm spoiled because I get much good Mexican food in San Diego. Regardless, this place stinks. I've given it a few tries and I must go out of my way to advise you to stay away. Two of the three girls taking your order are downright unfriendly... so they're off to a bad start. The food screws with your system, your plumbing. Low quality meat and fish... and they use some kind of freaky grease to cook. It'll go right through ya.

Be kinder to yourself; avoid at all costs.
author: Tom M.

description: Raised their prices again. 7$ for a regular burrito and 9$ for a super burrito. A typical burrito joint.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Zorro is surprisingly good for being smack dab in the middle of North Beach, swimming in a sea of touristy Italian restaurants. 

I've never been bummed about my burritos here. They're not the best in the city but it's open late, cheap, fast and filling. 

Quick side note: I hate the "bouncer" working here. Why on earth does a cheap Mexican taqueria have a bouncer-type dude that randomly checks order numbers? Do I look like I'm a burrito thief?  Kind of ridiculous.
author: Alli J.

description:
I can't believe anyone has anything other than great things to say about this place.  I guess the big negative is that it isn't any closer to fidi.  I am so tired of Tlaloc ruining my burritos with cactus it's seriously not funny anymore.

The super carne asada burrito is huge $8.05 out the door, and taste like real mexican food!  The salsa bar is sparce, with only 3 choices, but amazing.  I guess the drawbacks are the ambience is not somewhere you like to go hang out for a eat-in lunch and the chips are really really awful.
author: jeremy S.

description:
Best carne asada burrito I have ever had! The meat is so juicy and delicious. 

I live in the Mission and like everyone else here I consider myself a burrito aficionado. I was also under the impression that burritos served outside of the Mission weren't as good. Boy was I wrong! 

The prices are a bit steep by Mission standards, but fortunately burritos are only $6 on Wednesdays. My coworker and I spend the first half of the week anticipating our Wednesday burrito lunch tradition.

Minus 1 star due to the poor quality of salsas available.
author: Paul W.

description:
Four stars just for the Zorro burrito. It's that good. 

I've sampled some of their other offerings -- tacos on Taco Tuesday, for example -- and found them middling. But the Zorro...avocado and french fries in a burrito? Yes, please. It's a little heavy and a touch on the greasy side, but if this is a problem for you, you're probably barking up the wrong tree going to a taqueria. 

The food is cheap and the service is prompt. Go for the Zorro, stay for an additional Zorro.
author: Michael T.

description: I was recently in the city and after a long day of walking all over, I needed a quick but somewhat healthy dinner. I did not have to time have a seated meal and there were a few shady looking places in the area. I noticed Taqueria Zorro and thought I would give it a chance. When I walked in it looked pretty clean, the salsa bar looked maintained and did not have salsa droppings all over. After checking out the menu I opted for a chicken burrito. You could see all the food being cooked and all the prepped food behind the glass looked somewhat fresh. It was almost 7pm and they had a few people at the tables and a couple to go orders waiting. After about 5 minutes my order was ready and everything was correct, Took my order to go and about half way through my burrito my mouth was on fire, I like spicy food  and I can usually handle the heat, but it was spicy. I would have liked if it was just a tad less hot so I could have enjoyed the other flavors like the chicken, beans and guac. I finished the other half later and it was still spicy, but it was good. The perfect dinner on the go and everything agreed with my tummy. I would go back when I am in the area, but I think I would ask for salsa on the side or mild. I used the restroom while I was there and although it was down a funky hallway, it was clean. Which was a real bonus because the bathroom in the pizza shop across the street was gross!
author: Yana W.

description:
*Big vegetarian burritos: Check
*Salsa bar: Check [awesome green salsa]
*Open late: Check
*Beer: Check
*Drunk people stumbling around outside to watch while you wait for your food: Check

Sounds like a good taqueria to me! 
And it's now replaced my old neighborhood favorite of La Parilla Grill, that used to be across the street and closed.
author: Sarah S.

description: Consistently high quality Mexican food.  Typically get their mushroom quesadilla super.  Walk-up short order, seating area.  Nothing special in eating area, for me works best as to-go food.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
Best Late Night Drunk Food!  I have never come here before midnight.  The nachos are a great dish to share with friends after a hard night of going out.  

However, maybe it is the only child in me, but I love the FISH BURRITOS or the PRAWN BURRITOS.  For nachos, the ideal choice is Al Pastor or Chorizo, but for the burritos, man nothing tops these burritos.

They have these little Corona Little Buckets, which is not really worth it.  Drink first, and then come there afterward.
author: Min P.

description:
I've came here a few times solely to get the Zorro Burrito/California Burrito/SoCal Burrito. 

I always come to dine-in and the TV is usually pretty loud but the taste of those french friends inside the burrito more than makes up for it. Overall the place is 3.5-4 stars and I'll round up for them.
author: Terry M.

description: I always get into with people about authentic taquerias opposed to taquerias for "GRINGOS" or "TRANSPLANTS".. This place is very authentic to me. Just missing live mariachi music.. Its typical to pay almost $!) for a super burrito in san francisco now a days but most of them sucks. This place was good and they had black beans too. A lot of places dont.. this place has a wide variety of combos and fixings.. Come check it out its right for you... Had a super carne asada burrito with everything... even the chips was fresh
author: Tareau B.

description:
Very average overpriced Mexican food in North Beach. Nothing here is great and everything OK. Unfortunately, theres nowhere else to get a burrito in the neighborhood so I eat here twice a week.

Chili Relleno burrito is the best bet but they will be sold out when you go. Also, try the green salsa if its thick and hasn't been watered down with ice cubes.
author: Mike S.

description:
Just a quick update.

Make sure instead of just getting carne asada you mix in the lengua with the carne asada and you get the perfect flavor!  Thank and till my next burrito.  ENJOY!
author: Patrick T.

description:
No good, not good at all. They make a massive burrito but that just means more to throw out. Why are there peas in my carne asada burrito? 

I felt sick for hours after, maybe it's my fault for not going in drunk?
author: matt l.

description: This place is on the way home from work for me and it's convenient to stop and grab a burrito before walking up the hill.  Very recently, they applied a rule of allowing only 3 small plastic containers of salsa per order.  So, while if you stay there to eat, you can help yourself to as much of their salsas as you want, if you take it to go, it's too bad for you because three's the max.  3 small plastic cups for a big burrito and the chips is not enough for me.   But if I want my usual 5 small containers, they now want to charge me $1 more.   It's the small things like this that break a restaurant for me.  There are others that are more accommodating to long term customers.  Best of luck to Zorro....
author: Melissa R.

description: I like this place enough to come again (and again and again, especially since it's the closest Mexican place next to my house AND takes credit card!) but it's not the best Mexican food I've had. They were really accommodating though, and made my burrito without the tortilla shell in a to-go box (faux-burritobowl!). Half of my box was filled with chicken, so I definitely feel like I got my money's worth. My to-go order also came with a bag of chips and salsa, which was unexpected and really nice!
author: Melody L.

description:
A roommate concurs with me, this is hands down the best Burrito place for Nob Hillers/Chinatowners. NOT THE BEST, but the BEST in the area. It'll do the trick. 

TAKE-AWAYS: 
- The burrito is huge. That's what she said. 
- The "crispy" tacos come to you in an open shell/pie/salad sort of deal. It's not wrapped up at all, so it might come as a surprise to you. HOWEVER, for a light but firm meal, it's perfect. 

Until a better place comes along, this stands on top of the echelon, simply because there are barely any Hispanic joints in this area.
author: Abel L.

description:
For not being in the Mission this place has great Asada burritos (super w/ no rice is the way to go)
Friendly service
not too pricey
quick
fresh food
in the Broadway area so you may fall in love with a stripper while you much on tacos.
author: Life L.

description:
I came here once a few years back and thought the food was horrible. Since my friend wanted mexican, we came here because it was close. Maybe it's because it was really late in the night, or maybe it's because after being in SF for 3 years after living in San Diego I've finally got over how a burrito should really taste..but the super burrito with carne asada was to.die.for. the carne asada was so juicy, along with the sour cream and guac. mmmm, i can taste it as i write about it. i was supposed to bring most of it back for my boyfriend, and you better believe he was sad when he realized half was gone. 

My friend got nachos, which were also delicious! This is now just not a last resort kind of place, i'm pretty sure i'm craving one of their burritos right now.
author: Natalie J.

description: Great carne asada burrito!! Go here with my coworkers, now that is getting fed, serious burritos people... Yum
author: Becky U.

description: Love their food. Best Mission style burrito I've found in North Beach. Sometimes they get the order wrong, sometimes they don't answer their phone, etc. but still a regular spot for me.
author: M R.

description: They have a California Burrito (a real one, with fries, carne asada, guac, and no superfluous fillings like rice; if  you are from SD you will know how important this is)! This, my friends, is a rare find in SF, and definitely worth the $6.95 you pay... There is not a lot of interaction between the "chef" and the cusomter, otherwise I would give them a 5.
author: Carrie L.

description: Ever since having carne asada fries in san diego I have been on a quest for something equivalent in the bay area. Now i can't say that their nacho fries necessarily blew my socks out of the water, but they were pretty good.
author: Sunni B.

description: This place is awesome. Huge servings and they aren't cheap with the sides. Buy a couple coronas to go with your meal. This was a great place for lunch after exploring China Town and North Beach area.Very filling.
author: Paul G.

description:
To finish off my anthology of Santacon, I'd like to bestow the following title to Taqueria Zorro: The establishment that saved me from the abyss.  

As we staggered and swaggered our way down the streets of North Beach looking for some food to sooth our stomachs, we found many of the establishments were cash only.  Not good, as apparently Santa doesn't carry cash.  We ran into some younger kids that were totally amped on Santa costumes, and they directed us to Taqueria Zorro.

Oh how wise these kids were, a regular Carne Asada burrito with no rice, and cheese later and my belly and soul were appeased.  They've got a pretty good salsa bar, with a few choices, each one tasty and fairly mild.  The bathroom at this joint is pretty wild, going through the door you think leads to the bathroom actually leads to a secret passage (staircase) down to said bathrooms.

Secret passages are cool.
author: Eric L.

description:
Tuesday = $1 Tacos (Regular price is $2.95)

Pollo, carne asada, pork all legit. Salsa and fresh limes for you on the side to help yourself. They also given you a roasted Jalapeno. 

He not a bad deal for a Tuesday. 

NOTE: The street its on is hella busy which is standard for North Beach and the restaurant is next to a strip club.
author: Tom L.

description: Very good service and food. The grilled veggies Burrito is my favorite meal:).
author: Sandra S.

description:
I was having a serious quesadilla craving last night after my bf suggested to get Mexican for dinner. I wanted to go El Burrito Express but it was closed when we got to the door!!! I couldn't settle for anything else but a quesadilla and he didn't wanna drive all the way to El Farolito so we came here after my sister suggested this place.

**Parking is such a bitch on Columbus st!**

Their menu was pretty big. They had burritos, quesadillas, tacos, nachos, flautas, fajitas, soups, menudo, etc.

The prices were higher then El Burrito so my expectations for it was higher. I went for the super steak quesadilla. It had steak, guacamole, sour cream, and tomato salsa. ($8.55) To my surprise, I like Zorro's quesadilla better then El Burrito, even though it's more expensive, it was really good, and huge. LOTS OF STEAK. BF got a super steak burrito with everything and it was humongous! He couldn't even finish it, and I don't even think I can finish it, which is a surprise since I eat so much. 

I want some more!
author: Juliane N.

description:
It's crazy to say I've only tried this place just last month when I used to work in the Telegraph Hill area often. With my recent gig, that was located in Telegraph Hill, all of my coworkers raved about the So.Cal burrito. They would come back to the office screaming, "OH MY GOD, YOU ALL NEED TO TRY THE SO.CAL BURRITO FROM ZORRO'S!" I was a bit skeptical, because I am not a burrito person (yeah, I know, what's wrong with me?) and the fact that, if I were to eat it for lunch, I was afraid I wouldn't not be able to concentrate afterwards. Since most of these folks raving and screaming about these amazing burritos were from So.Cal (San Diego), I decided to give it a chance.

What's different about a So.Cal burrito? There are french fries (along with guac, salsa, rice, beans, choice of meat, etc.) Yeah, you heard right, french fries--whaaaat! Don't knock it till you try it. 

I ate half the So.Cal burrito and I definitely couldn't concentrate after lunch. I wanted to pull a George Costanza by sleeping under my desk, but I didn't. I may have worked a little slower than usual, but all I could think was, "That was a damn good burrito." 

And I've been craving a burrito since.
author: K. E.

description:
I consider myself something of a burrito connoisseur. I blame it on my college days in San Diego - Roberto's, Alberto's, Santana's, Sombrero's, Cotixan...I am well-versed in the way of the burrito. 

Sadly, the burritos up in the Bay Area had not been living up to my drunken college memories. There was always something, well, OFF about them.  Not anymore.

We stumbled upon Taqueria Zorro serendipitously after Giordano's had stopped serving for the night and we needed drunk greasy food ASAP. I ordered the Super Burrito - overflowing with guac, chicken, pinto beans, rice, salsa, cheese....holy crap this is what my life has been missing! 

Absolutely delicious, probably not all that nutritious, but they serve you in your seat and hand out lots of water (which is ideal when it's 2 AM and a member of your party is pretending to be awake by propping his head up against a wall). They make ordering a snap, and are patient as can be when people fall on themselves trying to order "WHORE-CHAY-TA."

In other words, no better way to celebrate the passing of the first hour of 2008 than to be nose-deep in a TZ burrito.
author: Devon S.

description:
Carne asada tacos before having dinner. Tacos? Must try the legendary "mexican" tacos here in SF so Ive been told. We walked in here by chance and I just had to get me some tacos.... Carne asada ordered and it was decent! Not top notch or authentic as the tacos trucks in LA, but decent. Soccer games on tv and decor like youre in Ensenada's bars is throughout here.......

Enjoy.
author: Mike F.

description: Its a good place to go for solid gringo-grub after a night out at the numerous nearby sleazy bridge-and-tunnel dance clubs and/or strip clubs, if that's your bag.  They actually have very good burritos here, and they won't give you sh*t for asking to specialize it for you (e.g. more sour cream, light guac, etc.).  They pile on a huge amount of chicken, which is stewed and forked (not charbroiled) and is supple, juicy and flavorful.  Solid.
author: Rick H.

description:
A mission to eat a burrito at every taqueria in San Francisco brought my friend and I to Taqueria Zorro. The place was of his choosing. He had already covered the mission and needed to branch off. So there we were, real San Franciscans, sitting in a tourist trap ordering some hella expensive mexican fare. But what the hell do you expect? It's in North Beach, and you know what for being in North Beach it's really not all that bad. 

My friend the burrito expert found that the burrito was too loosely rolled. However, he found it excellent that they had a variety of beans and he really enjoyed their chorizo. I was not a fan of the dry beans in my taco and had to pretend that they were really the beans served at La Taqueria in order to make the best of the experience. A large amount of sour cream and cheap shaved lettuce accompanied my taco. Fortunately I was hungry enough not care about visual aesthetics. 

All and all, if you're drunk in North Beach and don't want to pay the big bucks for some unrememberable tourist food get your ass over here. Just do remember that the place might also be called Zorro because it carves a Z in your stomach after you've eaten there.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
After a horrible time at Cobb's Comedy Club, we decided to go eat around the area.  We found a hole in the wall taqueria, so we decided to eat there.

I order the burrito the way that I wanted with carne asada, lettuce, and salsa with no rice and beans. It was quick and fast within minutes we got our food.  I took a small bite and it was soooooo YUMMMY.  I ate the burrito hella fast, so I was full after just eating half of the burrito, plus it  was a fat burrito too.  It was only $6.35 what a great deal. 

My friend's had ordered a 4 taco's and 2 burritos and a breakfast burrito and they loved it. We would definitely go back again and again.  The foord was worth every penny.  We all loved this place.  I had found parking in a downtown chinatown garage for only $2 for 30 minutes on a late saturday night, but make sure you get your car out by closing time which was 11pm. Or else I dont know since we were done eating in 20mins.
author: Kay V.

description:
Disclaimer: I only write reviews when I hate or love a place. And I am livid but I will give their food 3 stars.

The girl working the register got my order wrong then made me pay to fix it. I ordered carne asada fries and she replied with "Zorro nachos?". I looked at the menu and said yes. - I received a burrito.  

It is not my fault Taqueria Zorro decided to call carne asada fries Zorro Nachos.  I hope the owner has a talk with his employees, because I just had a talk with mine and you can guess what Taqueria in North Beach we are going to avoid from now on.
author: Dani Z.

description:
Just stopped in for a burrito.

Lack of flavor. Lack of tasty salsa. Lack of...substance.
I can understand how this would be delicious after a night of North Beachin' - but for any other meal, don't bother.
author: Dustin M.

description:
Beware the spicy carrots!  They are NOT milder than the actual chiles in that bin with radishes and onions, but 10x more spicy.  Ouch ouch ouch.

Stumble in drunk to fit in with the crowd... the food is very filling and is great for soaking up that drunkenness really well before you expel it in a doorway later in the night.  Needless to say, It tastes better going down.

Try the burrito with the mexican flag colors on it... fun to share and enough to pick at among 2 or 3.  I splash every bite with some Tapatio.  Horchatas are the best, and remember what I told you about the evil carrots.
author: Marjorie B.

description: I came to Taqueria Zorro in search of Nacho Fries. As a relocated South Bay resident, NO Nacho Fries can compare to downtown San Jose's Iguana's Taqueria Nacho Fries. But Zorro's were quite tasty. The food is good and very afford able. I defiantly be returning.
author: Al O.

description:
If you work in the Financial District, you know it's impossible to find a good burrito around there. Some are decent, Alex's and Los Socio's are good in  moderation, but none are really damn good burritos like Gordo's or Pancho's serves up. 

Well, let me tell you a little secret: If you can muster up enough mid-afternoon energy, stroll up a few blocks into North Beach and have yourself some El Zorro. 

Plenty of seating, a jukebox, a salsa bar, a bucket of beers for $10, and pretty good burritos. Now don't get me wrong, these are not in anyway the greatest burritos ever, but they are good and probably the best in the downtown area. The burritos are huge too. I'm not a fan of the double-foil wrapping, but that's just me. All I'm saying is 1 layer of foil gets the job done. 

But seriously folks, these are pretty good burritos.
author: Justin B.

description: Looking for something semi-healthy, I went with the taco salad, which comes in one of those gigantic fried tortilla bowls, and managed to not eat any of that part! Yay me!  The rest was a generous portion of salad greens, black beans, grilled chicken and a half of a fresh avocado.  Plus salsa bar and being asked if I also wanted a little bag of tortilla chips to go, all this and a drink for around $7.  They had a burrito special that day and feature $2 tacos Tuesdays.  Looks to be a favorite of the neighborhood worker bees based on the line that formed behind me during my visit.  I'll be back.
author: e w.

description: If you like salsa that tastes like bland tomato sauce from a can and food that tastes like cardboard...  This place is for you.  They would not do a combo plate with a taco and chili relleno so I just got the chili relleno plate...  Almost $14 is what I was charged.. Wow!  not a fair price for what was served at all.  Both the red and green salsas were bland and completely void of heat.  I was really craving something spicy.  No chance at this joint.  When I asked if they had anything hotter she just pointed at the trough of pickled jalepenos...  That's not heat by the way.  Enough said.  Will never return.  And In a city like SF with so many great Mexican joints there is really no excuse for food this bad.  The bar is set high Zorro,  Step it up!
author: Tony M.

description:
The food is great, cheap, and open HELLA late which is good. My friends and I would get wasted, take the bus over here and get good food. Hey I'm honest...
Problem with this place is that it is not the cleanest. The bathroom is down right nasty. It s a scene outta a TJ spring break gone wrong special on MSNBC lol. Horrifying....
But the food is still good. Go for sure but stay away from the bathroom
author: Stacy R.

description: Now can we just take a moment to say "WOW those Taco's are TASTY!!!".. I love this place with passion!! Fast and friendly service, nice and moist burritos (don't even need extra salsa sometimes - and i'm usually a salsa-freak!).. The tacos are 'you get your money's worth' size!! Love this place, it's a once a weeker for me at least!
author: Rak P.

description:
Zorro is Spanish for Fox.  And Ill be damned if the tacos here aren't more foxy than anything in the strip clubs nearby.  (Just a hunch)  Watch now as our cunning hero outfoxes authority, outsmarts foxy foes and outrageously eats four tacos in a sitting...

Our Backdrop:  
In the true spirit of Don Diego de la Vega, Taqueria Zorro defends the people of North Beach against tyrannical touristy Italian joints and provides a safe haven for ravenous intoxicated travelers.  On a brisk Thursday evening, a mysterious masked man manages to slip past the sirens that lure the lost travelers into dungeons of lust and destitution.  With football flashing on the big screen and the scent of spices sifting from the salsa bar, our hero dashes past the damsels and into the taqueria's dining room ... undetected.

Our drama unfolds: 
Hungry after a few hours of swashbuckling with the bumbling authorities and charming damsels in distress, Zorro arrives and orders not one but two carne asada tacos.  With a side of ... a chicken taco.  Oh and one al pastor.  And better get one of those $10 dollar corona buckets.  The villagers gasp.  

Our conclusion:
Zorro is too cunning and foxlike to be stopped, and he delights in publicly humiliating those who doubt his dedication.  The tacos fall in rapid secession - prey to a swift crack of his whip or slash with his sword.  He has never met a taco here that he hasn't seduced.  This night was no different.   The bottles sat sadly in their bucket.  Now only limes where beer once beckoned.  The villagers cheered - knowing once again they had witnessed the legend.  And the dancing damsels were then freed from their dungeons to run away with our dashing hero.  A few pounds heavier, some salsa on his cape, and a sharp smell of onions on his breath.  But as foxy and unpredictable as ever.   

Our moral (or lack thereof):
You, too, can stop by Zorro and have a tasty taco for (or four) yourself.  And someday, if you are lucky, or better yet in distress, you may catch a glimpse of our mysterious masked hero and legendary cunning linguist yourself.  

Z
author: Brad C.

description:
I've been here a few times, usually late at night after leaving some night spot and just before heading on home.  The place sort of reminds me of Mel's.  When I'm there eating late at night I love it and it tastes so good, but I wouldn't ever want to eat there in the light of day.

At night when my senses aren't all that awake, the food does taste good (it's hot, it's spicy), but some things are off.  The meat for one.  The carnitas always look dry as if they've been sitting out for days and the asada is a definite no go.  Asada/skirt steak as it is, is really cheap to buy so if their asada is on the lower end, well you can imagine...  Also, the al pastor there.  I love al pastor but my mom always told me to be careful where I order it from because sometimes it's old just hidden under all those spices.  Hmm...

But enough about the meats which were sub-par.  Everything else is decent, not the freshest ingredients, but decent (albeit a little overpriced).  The people are pretty friendly though.

Bottom line, if you are in No Beach and are craving Mexican food well this is your place.  It's nestled between strip clubs, and plenty of Italian restaurants.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This place is pretty good. A little ways from my work but hell, the old pancho villas at the waterfront is probably farther. 

Anyways, their burritos are pretty decent. Pretty good flavor considering they are not in the mission or in SJ or where other mexican-food-loving people congregate. 

I like their salsa bar - it's not big but has stuff I like. 

Their 1 dollar tacos are the best. I've been there the past two weeks and the portions differed...but they are still good. 

anyways, I'll be back.
author: Leena C.

description:
5 stars for being open all the time, dishing out some huge burritos that I like. Mojado burritos are where it's at.

Minus one star because I have run into some pretty sketchy clientele in this place, but it appears they now have security on Saturday nights. I guess I should expect this from a taqueria next to a strip club, but nonetheless...

Minus one star for the girls that take your order because they're woefully misanthropic.

Plus one star because the sell Coronas BY THE BUCKET. YES.
author: Eston B.

description:
Call me stupid.

Call me uncultured.

When I see that huge street of Italian places on Columbus I have no idea which one to pick.  Many have the "People On Yelp! Love Us!" sticker.  Dishes of gnocchi start to look the same on a printed menu. 

In reality I'm just too lazy.  I wanted something good and my stomach wouldn't give me time to make choices.  I saw a sign that said taqueria and went for it.

Taqueria Zorro didn't disappoint me.  They didn't have some of the extras and additions in the burritos I'm used to at other places but when it came down to it, I got a tasty, meaty burrito that hit the spot.  There's a decent amount of space and a few TV's in case you feel like hanging out for awhile.  The prices are about average with a super burrito coming in between $6 - $7.

If I'm ever indecisive and drunk in North Beach again, I'll be banging on the gate of this place if it isn't open...
author: Steven R.

description:
THIS TRULY IS THE BEST TACO JOINT IN SF... open late night for the hungry, their burritos were GINORMOUS...

i was pretty drunk the entire time i was there after a late night adventure at the club... but i KNOW my eyes opened up as i was handed my burrito... it was heaven.  steak GALORE in their carne asada anything.  we had a big group, and we all had jealousy pangs when we all recieved our food... 

"hungry with our eyes, and not stomachs..."

- but we were ALL SATISFIED with what we had... sooo yummy, but such a far drive from local nightlife... i also asked for an extra side of sour cream...

- they gave me an ENTIRE CUP OF SOUR CREAM... and like a hungry kitten, i devoured the cream along with my burrito... completely.
author: Sharon T.

description:
Ok, so let me preface this review with the fact that I was totally crunk when I ate here.

So, I did this underground race in the Park. Which turned out to be more about drinking than riding my bike. So I roll out of there and meetup with some friends in North Beach. My friends took one look at me and said ok, we need to get you some food before you drink anymore...ok!

See we went across the street from the bar we were at and there was a Taqueria??! WTF? Tacos in North Beach? I order two tacos al pastor and a tamarindo Jarritos(my fav). 

Helped myself to chips, salsa and the pickled jalapenos and carrots. The tacos we're really good. I would definitely eat there again, but I live in the Mission so I wouldn't make a trip out there.
author: isaias J.

description:
Standard late-night snack.  The torta (toasted white sandwich spread with refried beans, guacamole, sour cream, cheese, onions, jalapenos, & your choice of meat) is pretty delicious paired w/lime & a huge soft drink.  Chips & salsa on the side (note: extra chips = $1)!  Don't DRIVE here just to eat, parking might be a problem....

Is it just me or is the green salsa is redolent of gazpacho?

Cash Only
Torta = $6.95
author: Christina J.

description:
Oh, man. This place sucks. I didn't eat mexican food for a year after eating at this dump. So gross. Especially the quesadillas. They are literally dripping oil. Like tablespoons of oil. 

And they never, EVER, get their orders right. Seriously. I used to work down the street from them and sometimes ordered the nachos (because that's the only eatable thing they have). I would order the super nachos, or whatever they were called. They were supposed to come with cheese, bean, guacamole, the works. And sometimes I'd open it and it would just be nachos. CHIPS!! Seriously. If they had just forgotten the guacamole, that's one thing. But just dry chips?

Anyway, if you are absolutely starving and low on funds, then maybe this place could be good. That's why they get the one star. And if you're ordering to go, make sure you check your order before you leave. I guarantee it's missing something.
author: Carla P.

description:
My two word review: Mediocre & Overpriced.

Unfortunately for me, I work just 2 blocks away, so it's the closest taqueria, leading me to eat there every so often.  But after maybe 6 or 7 burritos, I have to say that I've never had one that I'd call "good".  "Adequate" is as far as I'm going to go.  

Here's the deal: I eat stripped-down burritos (I'm a vegan), so I'm really interested in them getting the basics right.  They only have plain flour tortillas, so nothing special there.  Their refried beans are bland -- seemingly without any flavor or richness.  Their rice is not only bland, it's consistently undercooked.  Few things I hate more than crunchy rice in a burrito!  Their guacamole is almost more of a salsa, with chunks of undercooked onions and other things in it; it's also runny.  Inexplicably, although they grill their tortillas, once they wrap them in foil, they steam them!  This, of course, makes the tortilla gummy.  No idea.

To top it off, this burrito is more than $5.  And they don't take plastic, but they do have an ATM machine that will gladly keep $3 for the privilege of giving you your money.  Grrr!  And the interior is as charmless and dingy as...er...a taqueria, but in say, the Tenderloin.

I'll probably eat at Zorro again, and I'll undoubtedly complain about it every time I do.  What I wouldn't give for El Burrito Express to open a branch in this neighborhood!

Edit: A better local burrito has been found!  See my review of La Parrilla Grill.
author: Curran H.

description: I love this place cause they are always opened late.  This is a great place to come to when you are partying in North Beach.  Good tacos and a hidden downstairs bathroom to party in as well.  Rocking!
author: graham p.

description: I was desperately looking for a quick place to eat at on a Sunday. I found this small looking taqueria and couldn't have thought of a better lunch. Although this place might look small there's actually a decent amount of seating especially in the back with a flat screen television. I had a carnitas burrito. They make it fresh so there's steam flying everywhere. I found the burrito pretty good. The only problem is that they wrap the burrito in like three layers of foil even if you're eating-in. If you like opening presents then come here. The salsa bar is pretty small and only offers one type of spicy salsa along with limes and peppers. I'd come back if I were lusting for a burrito. I hear that the vegetarian burrito is good too. I saw one customer order one while another ordered one with what I thought was "fries".
author: Michael H.

description:
Taco Tuesdays $1.75 tacos. many options to choose from. the meat is delicous, the seasoning is great. Most importantly great great salsa.

I prefer to go here over Nico's Tacos. Atmosphere is not as great but although Nico's is going for more California-Fusion tacos, side-by-side, Taqueria Zorro wins.
author: Dave C.

description:
Not sure why people are giving this place high marks. 

- Too expensive. Burritos are supposed to be 4$. There were items on the menu for almost 10$!
- Not that great. Salsa wasn't impressive, the chicken was over-cooked and generally bland. 

I am from Boston and there are a couple fantastic burrito joints in the city (Anna's Taqueria and Boca Grande) so my burrito expectations are high for SF. I imagine I will do better down in the mission, I suppose that's what I get for getting a burrito in north beach.
author: Scott T.

description:
My Go-to Mexican place and I love Mexican food.

I really wanted to bag on this place but it always has consistently great food. The torta is off the chains good and the so-cal burrito is another cant miss option. I have always gotten the steak and been happy having not gotten any of those funky fatty or gristle bits. 

Been there about a dozen times and they are still batting 1000 in my book. Plus they have a great salsa bar with that green creamy salsa that is one of my favs.
author: Chris B.

description:
Three stars is actually generous based on the last burrito I will probably ever get from this place.
Cold: seriously, by the time got it back to work, nothing was warm in my super veggie food log. Whatever warmth that the tortilla, rice and beans (hopefully) once had, was somehow lost. And it was warm day.
Wet: Sometimes liquid (from lettuce, salsa, etc) gathers in the bottom of burrito. I'm aware of this fact, and have made peace with many soggy burrito butts (get your mind out of the gutter), but with this particular burrito, it was already leaking out the sides halfway through. Not ok.

To their credit, the service is pretty good (but it helps if you know a little spanish when putting in phone orders), and their self serve salsa bar with 3 decent salsas and jalepenos/carrots is usually well stocked and of good quality.
author: Chadwick M.

description:
damn this place was good! I was asking our secretary about the taco truck down the street and she just shook her head and told me to go here. thank god she took the time to teach this naive grasshopper. 

My carne asada burrito came toasted and exploded with burrito condiments. it was totally messy, just how i like it! Enough mexican folks were eating in here, so i knew i was in the right hands.  I think this place really belongs in the mission, but hey, im happy its close to my work.
author: Michael N.

description:
Is it ridiculous that my favorite taqueria in San Francisco is nowhere near the mission? I love this place so much that I go every time I'm in town.

Hilarious anecdote: I once ordered beef fajitas to go. My receipt said 'beef fajitas lengua' Turns out 'to go' sounds like 'tongue' or something I don't know but let me just say BEST FAJITAS EVER to this native Texan.

I'm not a fan of the nightlife in the area or the particular crowd on weekends so I might recommend not hitting up Zorro then. But, you know, if you're into it then hit away.
author: melissa d.

description: Best taqueria in North Beach. Taco Tuesdays and Burrito Wednesdays. I don't order the wet burrito because last time they microwaved it. Yuck.
author: James C.

description: DO NOT GO HERE! I have occasionally eaten here over the past year and although I admit that the food tastes good, I just got home with my burrito and right in the middle is a wad of chewed peppermint gum!!!! What kind of place is this? Be warned. Not sure what else they may be doing to the food at Zorro. Nasty. I am going to tell everyone I know about this and you should too!
author: Kelly T.

description:
I used to love this place so much
Carne Asada Torta is sooo good.
It's gotten smaller and less fresh over the years.
Prices have increased dramatically.
Still okay Mexican food to fill the stomache.
LOVE that they open so late.
author: Paula Z.

description:
The $2.40 fish taco sign immediately drew me into this out-of-place taqueria in the middle of north beach.  The choice of grilled rather than fried fish was welcome, the white sauce complemented the fish well, and the portions were very generous.   

Without question the best quality-to-price ratio for fish taco I've found in SF so far.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Stopped in here after drinking in North Beach. Ordered a bunch of food I don't remember but I remember it was pretty good. Yum
author: Mike S.

description:
this is more like 3.5 than a true 4 stars...

i LOVE shrimp burritos...because shrimp is my favorite protein... so i search for places that have shrimp burritos... and they have it... 

what's good about this place is... well... the shrimps in the burrito are huge... and they are whole shrimps vs chopped ones.... 

everything else here is a regular mexican joint... they use to have a better salsa bar than what i saw last night... and they are kinda stingy on the veggie toppings for my super shrimp burrito... 

this isn't my favorite burrito place... but it does the job when i'm craving a shrimp burrito!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Another day, another super burrito.  Al pastor, with black beans please.

I had been to Zorro once when I was drunk, so of course it was awesome.  It was nice to come back sober and check it out.

The burrito was respectable; all of the ingredients were decent, they had the right proportions, everything was mixed up well enough and the cheese was melted.  Nothing about it really stood out as a great burrito, but if you're looking for Mexican in North Beach I'd check it out.  And if you're drunk, it will more than suffice.

They have pretty good salsa, but they don't have Tapatio which is a taqueria must-have in my book.
author: Joseph N.

description:
Taco Z is a little bit pricey for fast-food mexican, but at 2 AM it always hits the spot.  We usually get a burrito and they are always taste great.  For a beverage I'll say the horchata.  Tasty!  This would be a 4 star review if it was a little bit cheaper.  

Bonus: always a chance of some crazy causing a scene.
author: Jordan A.

description: OMG this place is amazing!!! I got the zorro nachos this time and the zorro burrito last time....so freaking delicious I am beginning to get addicted. Highly recommend this place! It's super easy to walk to, great location!
author: Jamie S.

description:
The first few times I came to TZ I hated it and proceeded to talk shmack about it to anyone that would listen.  Call me impulsive, I guess.  I was a vegetarian for 18 years and although I eat meat from time to time, I still choose the veg. options out of habit.  

That's where Zorro and I went wrong.  How could I be so foolish?  
GO FOR THE CARNE ASADA people!  The veggie burritos/tacos here are bland and tasteless.  The carne asada burrito is about the size of a football; a huge pouch of ooey-gooey goodness.
