I'm surprised no one's mentioned the $10 Corona buckets, but I guess the secret's out now...
author: Kerry D.

description:
Who woulda thought i woulda ended up here? Well, we spent too much time popping in and out of restuarants the demanded a 20-30 minute wait for the 6 of us.

We were all a little buzzed from the pre-dinner wine and cocktails at another bar, and low and behold, we stumbled upon this joint.

Mexican in North Beach? Who woulda thought?

Well, the tastes and textures were cosmically right on for all 6 of us. The food was good, it was filling, service was fast, and we got a lot of food for not much money. I'm glad we didnt' wait 30 mintues to be seated and talked into having another glass of booze on a work night.

The chicken burrito helped me sober up for the drive home, and I still had money left in my wallet after a night out with friends! Go figure!
author: Anita R.

description: If you are hungy and need the bare minimum meal to avoid upchucking unnecessary food and burping vile odors then head to Zorro's for the basic chicken burrito.  Good shredded chicken, juicy and tender, beans and rice.  I get it with sourcream but I ask them to hold the salsa.  I hate the taste of cilantro when I can still taste the whiskey in my mouth.
author: Shiho F.

description: Solid, fresh, authentic-tasting Mexican food, as in not overly salted to hide flavors that shouldn't be there, and not food that tastes good only when you're drunk and/or desperate, i'm a fan :)
author: Lana L.

description:
I've been to Zorro about 25 times. Their burritos aren't that good, so-so at best; their tortas are soggy and rather undersized. I've found that their carnitas, carne asada, and chorizo are quite dry. and i find their green "guacamole" sauce to be an inadequate substitute for avocado, or hell, even guacamole. 

YET, i keep going back.

Why, you ask? Because every once in a while, they get it right, especially if you get the chile verde, which has been the exception to their pro-dry meat platform. The possibility of getting a decent burrito (based on sheer chance) in concert with its convenient proximity to my office has somehow drawn me back over and over, despite my full appreciation of just how not-great the place is.

On a side note, if you're drunk, it might be decent, but even if you're drunk, if you can drive out to the mission, you're better off getting some farolito.
author: Bernie L.

description:
YES! - I've finally found a great tasting, inexpensive Mexican restaurant by my office again.  I was a bit sad, b/c I hadn't had any Mexican food recently, b/c the restaurants all have been raising their prices, so a burrito now costs almost $10 at most of the restaurants downtown.  

This place is awesome, b/c the food is freakin' delicious (I had a super chicken burrito yesterday for lunch w/ some chips and salsa for only $7.58 - that's a bargain for Mexican food in downtown in the Financial District).  It tasted fresh and their portions are very generous (I was barely able to finish it all, and I had major food coma after I got back to my office.... so it made crunch numbers a bit harder that afternoon...but sooo worth it).  

The location is a bit off the usual trail for most people working downtown, since it's up in North Beach, so it was not crowded at all - that's just fine by me.  You should definitely check out this place if you're around the area.
author: Minh V.

description:
Greasy. Dirty. Fast. 

I should've known by the color of their guacamole, staleness of their chips & oily smell to avoid Taqueria on North hill. My girlfriend and I wandered into this glitzy place, ordered a grilled vegetarian burrito, corn quesadilla & horchatta. All were dripping with grease, I felt my stomach wanted to curl inside itself after the meal. 

The salsa bar was dirty and stale. The peppers looked appetizing but I was afraid I was ingesting week old condiments. 

People said this place is cheap...??? Go to the Mission district and find real authentic Mexican food. This place is a tourist trap.
author: Jack C.

description:
Absolutely the worst Mexican food I've ever had the displeasure of eating. 


While my girlfriend and I were in town we had a craving for some good 'ol Mexican food. Living in Southern California we've eaten plenty of delicious hole-in-the-wall Mexican food for cheap and this was 1000% not it. We got two super burrito's, her's with chicken mine with Chili Verde.

Right away I was taken aback by the girl behind the counter. After she took our order she proceeded to bite her nails while filling our drinks and handling the lids. Who puts their fingers in their mouth then handles customer's food? Seriously? Again, out the of hundreds of little Mexican joints I've been to I've never seen something that gross.

Anyway, we get our food and I take the first bite into my burrito and what do I get? An extremely hard, dry, large piece of pork. The pork they used was so hard that the plastic knives they supply CANNOT EVEN CUT IT. The rice was so over cooked that it turned to mush in the burrito.

After all was said and done we walked out of there $24 poorer and still hungry. Needless to say we didn't eat Mexican food again until we got back home. I am very surprised by the other reviews here giving them anything higher than one star. Maybe those people never had real good Mexican food? If I could give them zero stars I would.
author: Brock H.

description:
It's unbelievable that I found an awesome Mexican place near my work. I really can't believe it. Please pinch me. Ok, enough gringo emotion. 

I LOVE Mexican food. I grew up eating Mexican food. This place is great. Everything is good. The people working there are "authentic". I even got heckled by the woman at the register for daring to ask whether the combo plate included corn tortillas. Yes! Heckle me. I love it.

Invited my friend from L.A. up here. He grew up in Wilmington. Trust me, he knows Mexican food. He couldn't believe the carne asada taco was so good. He's a SoCal snob, like me, when it comes to Mexican food. Enough said?  

Ok, maybe it isn't. When he was here we saw a guy get out of a SUV and body-slam a pedestrian in the crosswalk . Ok, that has nothing to do with the food, but, if you show up on Friday or Saturday night, you've been warned.
author: Rich M.

description:
I had the nachos here once before, and they were so good! Granted, i was drunk but under that condition the nachos were out of this world.  Ate them again last night and I was only slightly buzzed, and they were not good.  The chips that they used tasted like they were bought from a grocery store.  

Gimme a taqueria that fries their own tortilla chips, or give me....lots of salsa to cover them up!
author: Jackie D.

description: Not too bad for being at the intersection of Chinatown and North Beach. Very spicy. Decent.
author: Andrew K.

description: This place is a shit hole.  But the food is incredible.  I really wish there was a wall up so I didn't have to see the vats of meat and other food...but it is good enough that I don't care.  Get it for take out.  It is the only mexican food in North Beach worth eating.
author: Kacy L.

description: Made a visit here recently b/c of a Scoutmob promo.  Walking up, I realized that this is the very spot where I had eaten multiple times completely faded.  Never remember it being anything more than mediocre at best, which is an egregious sign considering how the food palate stoops to much lower standards when inebriated.  The stars aligned and allowed me to return again, this time totally sober.  Got the Zorro burrito, which is basically a California burrito - carne asada/avocado/salsa/sour cream/fries.  It's simple, no cheese/rice/beans.  Total came out to $3.50 w/ tax, which was the first plus.  Second plus - holy jeebus it was delicious.  They didn't skimp on the meat and it was probably the best sized rice/bean-less burrito I've ever seen.  Touch of the fries was just right, didn't mask anything, but still could appreciate the contrast from beans/rice.  Overall as a joint though, this place is still hit or miss.  It could be a lot better given their prices, but if you ever happen to stumble into this place, voluntarily or not, try the Zorro burrito.
author: Jeff S.

description: I think $8 is a bit much for a super burrito but they're pretty damned big at this place and fill you up.  I usually only eat about half in one sitting and then save the rest for later.
author: Paige W.

description:
Just ok.

Tasty for drunk people, not so spectacular for the sober.
author: Holly F.

description:
This is my favorite taco-stand in San Francisco!  It is so good!  When ever I come here, I always buy a bunch of tacos because I just love this place.  I find myself taking a few along with me after I leave the place.

I really can not comment on anything other than the carne asada tacos and burritos, but from just those to items, I am in heaven.  

They use all fresh ingredients and the service is quick and friendly.  I can't believe some people don't like this place?  I guess they had a bad experience?  I don't know, I never had a bad experience and everyone that I ever introduced to this place have all given me the thumbs up on this place!
author: John O.

description:
I was on one of my North Beach jaunts, walking along past the girlie clubs and wondering if I could find something food-related rather than sex-related nearby. When I headed a bit further, I spotted Tacqueria Zorro on my right and headed over there. (How could I not try a Mexican food place in North Beach? The randomness just made it the perfect choice). 

  In any case, the pluses:

--It was pleasantly quiet, a refuge from the construction outside, and seemingly tourist free
--My grilled veggie burrito was about $6, although I could have purchased a simpler one for $5 something...not too shabby at all. 
--I brought my own water and didn't feel tacky for drinking it there. Thanks, Zorro's!

And the minuses:

--The burrito was delish, but nsomewhat heavy. If I'd had a way of transporting it home, I would have done so. I'd recommend splitting it with a friend.

Otherwise, good times, really--I felt completely refreshed after going there.
author: Beth F.

description:
Went into today for the second time in the past few weeks. Won't ever be going back again.

My super burrito wound up costing me an astounding $17.05 by the end.

I ordered a beef super burrito, price tag $7.05. Gave the lady behind the counter a $20. Got $2.95 back. Said "Hey didn't I hand you a $20?" She said "no, you handed me a $10." Strange considering I'd just gone to the ATM and withdrawn $40, and now only had 1 $20 left in my wallet. 

The burrito is good, its just not $17.05 good and the service is...well... not the greatest. If you plan on going, make sure you pay with exact change to avoid what happened to me. Regardless of if its a mistake or intentional I can't support a business that rips off customers.
author: Jason N.

description:
I think this is the only mexican restaurant in North Beach - it's near work, so came here for dinner. 

It's a bit on the pricier side - regular tacos are $2.55 each and they're pretty small. I also had a veggie taco salad - it came in a crispy tortilla bowl with black beans, lettuce, corn, cheese, avocado, salsa and spanish rice. Some of their burritos are priced in the $8-$9/range. My friend had enchiladas and they looked small compare to the restaurants in the Mission. I liked the horchata, but you can't really mess that up! 

Overall, the food was OK and it was playing soccer on the TV so that was nice.
author: Gladys C.

description:
Maybe more like 2.5 stars.

  Extremely average gringo-style taqueria. No buche, no tripitas, no cabeza, just the usual stuff, except they do have lengua. Unfortunately the lengua is bland, mushy and totally dissapointing. The camarrones are rock-hard and nasty, the al pastor watery and chewy, but the carnitas ain't bad. Matter of fact the "El Zorro Torta" with carnitas is really damn good - depending on who makes it! Unfortunately they tend to run out of it by the time the sun goes down, so usually I just end up with the super vegeterian burrito - which ain't any cheaper than the meaty burritos.

  Their salsa bar is totally average and in danger of being overshadowed by El Pollo Loco, which is just sad.

  A big gripe is that the restroom is permanently "out of service" so if you want to stop in here for cervesa and tacos after binging at Grant & Green, O'Reilly's or your watering hole of choice, you are going to be cameling it until you get home or make it to your next destination, which really freakin' sucks.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Had a Super Burrito with Carnitas which came with some decent chips. When I got home I noticed there wasn't any salsa for the chips. The burrito was huge though, and I couldn't eat the whole thing at one sitting. Definitely a good deal for $7...

Update: both the chorizo and carintas tacos are damn good (with simply onions, cilantro, and sauce). Also found the salsa bar...

Update 2: carnitas taco(s) once a week never disappoint

Update 3 (May 2008): Not sure what happened here, but I've never had a worse taco in my entire life. Both tacos took forever to make, but i'm not sure why, as they weren't even cooked and tasted like shit. Never again....
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Yum yum yum in my tum tum tum!! How happy am I that there is this fab little restaurant down the street from me?? VERY!! 

Nothing but the burrito will do for me, especially with extra guac and hold the cheese. Then order a side of chips and salsa, only to sprinkle the salsa inside the burrito. Bite the top of the burrito off, maybe a few extra bites for good measure, then dip your chips in the yummy goodness that is the center of the burrito to really get the most out of it! Hmmmmmm........
author: Stephanie J.

description: The Carne Asada Nachos with everything are amazing! Great place to get a quick bite while drunkenly stumbling through North Beach.
author: Adrienne P.

description: The food wasn't too bad. However, I wanted something to quench my thirst and tried to buy the smaller size coronas. Cashier wouldn't give me one, instead upselling me on a larger size. On a beer. Wow. Great place for drunks and tourists.
author: Vincent Y.

description: I'm giving this place three stars.  I tried a Zorro Burrito and it was pretty good, but way too expensive.  I used Scoutmob and would not go back here and pay full price for that burrito.  I'd rather make my own fries and stick it in a burrito from another place, even Gordo, which I'm not that fond of.  I would have loved to wash that burrito down with some horchata, but they were all out.  The front of the place was drafty and the back was hella loud because there was a jukebox blasting music.  I'm not that old, but it was even too loud for me.
author: k h.

description: I don't know what's with all of the bad and mediocre reviews.  Me gusta Taquieria Zorro!  It is a hole-in-the-wall joint, but the food is yummy.  Their breakfast burritos (HUGE) and super quesadillas (HUGER) are tasty and delicious!
author: Patti L.

description:
DAAAAAAMN THESE BURRITOS ARE SO FRESH! SNAP!

Seriously though, it was pretty good... I had a super veggie burrito and I got the spicy salsa... WOW! The salsa was probably the best part, it had this smoky flavor that I REALLY enjoyed... I wondered if maybe they use MSG, because this shit was unnaturally tasty.

Okay, and now the bad... After finishing off a little over half of my burrito, I found a thick, black hair interwoven with the lettuce. It turned my stomach, but being poor has taught me to see past things like this, so I picked it out and kept eating... Ugh.

This place is open late and about 4 blocks from where I live, so I'll definitely be eating here again...
author: P A U L.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 90

Thank goodness that place got above an 80. I didn't get a shrimp burrito because I thought it had a low score...

What a pleasant surprise! 

I can always tell how good a taqueria is by tasting their basics: a super veggie burrito. It was nice and wet, lots of good flavas, and inexpensive.

Though no burrito will compare to Ocean Taqueria, this place satisfied my hunger after a long day a work and a long night at the clubs. 

The next time I'm on Broadway and I am not craving Chinese food, I'll come back and try their tostadas!
author: Kristina C.

description: Tasty, quick and cheap! Super Carne Asado Burrito no guac or onions, with sliced avocado $6.50. Huge burrito, ate half today - and now have lunch for tomorrow!
author: Janine L.

description: Ultra low quality meet cooked badly, rude slow service, and small portions.  Skip it even on Taco special days.  I know it is about it for Mexican food in the area, but that it still no excuse for the place. Go else where.
author: Derek n.

description:
Not the best, but that isn't to say I wouldn't come back. Just means, if I had few choices and was having a bad night, I'd come back to what I know wouldn't disappoint me completely. 
I had a breakfast burrito with chorizo, egg, potatoes and cheese. The burrito was gigantic - seriously who can eat that much burrito? The cheese wasn't completely melted which kind of sucked. And frankly, the food lacked some taste. But it didn't taste awful, just had nothing to taste really. 
Breakfast burrito and coke cost me $10, which I think is kind of pricey but you're in North Beach - go eat Italian!
author: Liliana A.

description:
Great salsa, get the burrito without the sour cream as the put a little much. 

Definitely overpriced, but best burrito in North Beach.
author: John B.

description: Not bad, as far as these places go.  Food was a bit salty and the bathroom was out of order.  This is definitely a place to visit AFTER the bar.
author: Robert M.

description: Good food, just you cannot eat all the food in one night, the portions are even too generous
author: Pamela F.

description: Really good tacos. I like them better than Nick's, and they're not as expensive. I had the carne asada and grilled chicken.
author: Steve S.

description:
Get the chicken burrito.  It's potentially the best in the city.  I wouldn't recommend anything else there, but the chicken burrito is SO good that it alone merits 4 stars for Taqueria Zorro.

Tip: you can get half off coupons on the back of receipts at the Safeway a few blocks away on Jackson St between Front St and Davis St.
author: kiely c.

description:
Probably the best option for a mexican "antojitos" restaurant if you are in North Beach.

I recommend the "Carne Asada Quesadilla", it's huge and it's probably the best value for your money. Sauces are not great , they could do a better job by cleaning a bit that area, and they are usually marked as "mild", "regular" and "spicy" which is not spicy at all.

Someone else also mentioned the "Corona Cubetas" which is a good deal for San Francisco prices. 

Also if you are a "Futbol" fan , theres always a game on the TV.

I'll give it three stars only because I'm mexican and I'm not used to pay 8 dollars for a quesadilla and a coke. Sauces could be better and the chips, that you get as appetizers before your food is ready, taste like crap.

Food is good, above average, service is great.

Tres Estrellas!

ciao
author: Daniel C.

description:
I used to come here for lunch about once a week as their Burritos were very very tasty. For under $7, I would get a Carnitas Super Burrito to go and that would fill me up until the evening time. The Burrito packed a nice punch and the meats were very tender and flavorful. 

I believe this place started getting a ton of business from their $1 Taco Tuesday, which is now $1.50, but it was totally worth it as they didn't skimp on the meat or fixings. This drew a huge crowd and now, I believe their attention to the food has drastically fell through. 


The Burritos are not as tasty anymore and they completely jacked the prices up. The customer service is not up to par and its completely disgusting when you find corn in the middle of your burrito, come on now CORN!
author: Thomas J.

description: The burritos are not the cheapest in the world but they are very good.  The people behind the counter are very friendly and this is a good place to grab a burrito and go for lunch.
author: david c.

description: Super tasty and fresh tacos. Everyone here is really friendly and the specials on Tuesday are definitely good value ($1.75 each).
author: Lucie C.

description: The guys who work here hook it up! The portions are big and the service is friendly. Taco tuesdays and burrito wednesdays!
author: Josie M.

description: I miss coming to this place.  I used to work right around the corner and would stop in every once in a while.  Always yummy after a long shift.  The people who work here are really nice even if sometimes there are communication barriers :).  I'll have to find some excuse to come back more often now.
author: Robin L.

description: Awesome burrito! It was a pound if it was an ounce. Great place for lunch. It could only be better if it was bigger.
author: Claude J.

description: dude!  Excellent burritos everytime!  Carnitas done the right way!  Deep fried chunks of pork...pulled and grilled just before they pile them into your burrito! I was like woah after every bite!  Carne asada is really good too!
author: Peter M.

description:
This is a great lunch spot if you work in the area, but don't go out of your way for a burrito here. Stick with the steak -- al pastor, if you're a fan, is disappointing. Otherwise it's a pretty standard Mexican joint. Coke in a glass bottle, free salsa station (chips'll cost you), and the requisite burrito assembly line behind the glass partition.
The eight-table dining room has a big TV that is perpetually showing soccer games. Whether they're actually live or just recorded and on repeat, I can't tell.
author: Marty S.

description: After walking by here about a thousand times in the last four years, I finally tried this place last night, not sure why I hadn't before. It's your standard SF/California taqueria...nice employees, interior a little dingey, plentiful portions. My burrito tasted exactly like burritos I've had at more than a dozen other places, but that's what I expect. I don't want to be surprised by my mexican food. I'm moving to Paris in two months and I know that I will be having major cravings for burritos just like this.
author: Rose K.

description:
i have not been this maddened, furious even, by treatment in a really long time, I actually cant remember the last time i have been so upset. 

if you are the owner this needs to be addressed!

after the giants game last night (game 5) everyone was celebrating in the streets, my boyfriend and i came in to grab dinner out of the chaos. We were wearing giants clothes but we were both sober and did not act the slightest bit unruly. i placed my order and my boyfriend said he will have the same thing. when the food was brought to the table 1 of the items was completely the wrong item, no big deal at all but i let her know in case it was supposed to go to someone else since our order was so simple. the waitress told me i was wrong and that this was what i ordered, still fine.. its just a take out burrito place so i didn't care all that much even though i was annoyed that i paid $9.75 and she would not even acknowledge she may be wrong. before she and i could conclude our very quick conversation i had the receipt unexpectedly grabbed from my hand and to my surprise found a VERY large security guard hovering over me (literally inches away and over my body as i sat in a seat). he was very aggressive and approached the situation as if i were causing a scene and about to start a fight or something. i was baffled, still am.. almost cant express in words. what started as me having a quiet conversation with my waitress turned into a man 3 times my size threatening me with his body presence obviously as a signal for me to shut up. i began to explain that we just had a mix up in the order but he didn't want to hear anything.. still standing his forceful ground over me within inches he demanded i either eat the burrito "i ordered" or get out. 

WHAT KIND OF SERVICE IS THIS!!!!! i am a 5'3" girl who came in, paid and clarified to my waitress i was given the wrong food then was basically threatened by a rent a cop 3 times my size to shut up and get out or he would make me. if i had been a vegetarian and was given my item i would have to leave without food because no one would listen to me. 

it was to the point where my boyfriend was silent the whole time with a stunned look on his face. afterward he said he didn't want to say anything because the approach that the security guard took indicated he would get physical if we said anything. 

we used to be regular customers to Taqueria Z and will never go back. if you support your employees acting in this manor i assure you, your customers have no business spending money there.
author: Barbara C.

description: Taco Tuesdays!!! $1 tasty ass tacos! My boyfriend and I were walking around planning on having a lil taste here and a lil taste there but after we tried one carnitas taco here we came back after a couple hours and got a few more. The carnitas was flavorful and juicy. Just about the best I've ever tasted. They have your standard little salsita bar so you can spice up your taco to your liking. tortilla chips were free (i think this is only if you eat there). My biggest complaint is that their toilet was out of order.
author: Niki P.

description: Pretty damn good burrito. Only thing missing... decent hot sauce.
author: Helen C.

description: Been here many times -- it always looks good from the outside as an alternative to the bad pizza by the slice and good chinese food options late on a party night in North Beach.  Atmosphere, service, etc., is just fine, and most of the customers on a busy night were local latinos.  Only problem is the food.  Chile Relleno was soggy and full of tasteless cheese.  Burritos are dry.  Salsas are okay but only two kinds.  They've got to have one of the worst fish tacos in town -- the wrong fish for the wrong dish.
author: Gil S.

description: We order 2 burritos and receive only one tray of chips. A hispanic dude walks up and asks for more chips, he gets another tray no questions asked. We go up and ask for another tray of chips, they ask for a dollar. Yah, fuck taqueria zorro. racist bastards.
author: Mike A.

description: Great cheap Mexican food open where you need it (North Beach) when you need it desperately (until 3am). I lived in San Diego for 6 years, and these burritos are comparable to the ones there. I'm partial to the Super Veggie Burrito, but don't let me limit you.
author: Kelly C.

description: Taco Tuesdays!! Great super cheap dinner on a Tuesday night. Love their carne asada. Chips are only so-so and that can be a deal breaker for me, but their salsa selection makes up for it. I always order too much food here and after the meals done deeply regret it and vow to not come back. But it's just too dang good. Their tacos and burrito's are awesome. It's a good break from the italian selections surrounding it.
author: Audrey V.

description: I live near here but always doubted trying this place because it was right next to a hustler club, the decor is whatever and plus I'm a germaphobe.  When I saw it highly recommended on Yelp I felt comfortable trying this place and absolutely love it!   And for someone who hates processed foods, them using fresh steak, chicken and large prawns for their dishes is fantastic.  I also really liked how they used fresh mixed garden salad for my tostada salad (not the cheapy iceberg kind).   Needless to say - I come back here often.  I'm not a big burrito fan, so I've never tried them. But I can at least vouch for their Tacos, their diablas and taco salads.  5 Stars for what it is.  Thanks guys for directing me to this place!
author: Ana L.

description: Average burrito, average steak quality. Nice low-cost alternative to the expensive overrated touristy stuff in the area.
author: Mark A.

description: Yay! I'm a fan! El Zorro has a really yummy grilled veggie burrito. It's stuffed with freshly grilled veggies, rice and salsa. It's so filling. They give you fresh chips and have a really good salsa bar too. But peeps, it's definitely a no frills taqueria. Think a little bit'o Mission in the heart of North Beach! They are always really friendly, inexpensive, delicious and fast. :) Oh and it's cash only.
author: Christy L.

description:
one of the best burritos in town.  or maybe it's because it used to be our go to spot for late night north beach dining.  we don't hang out in north beach much anymore, but luckily, i still work relatively close.

if i'm super hungry for a super burrito, i'll come here.  massive burritos that are big enough to save the second half for your next meal.

they have flautas too, which make me happy.  only complaint, they're stingy on the chips ... why???
author: spiff e.

description: Fast/Cheap/ Close by.. Live Football match's on Tv's 24/7...GOOOOOOAAAAAAALLLLLLLLL!
author: john c.

description: This place decent in my book.  Ups?  Good place to fill that burrito craving  when you live in Chinatown.  Downs?  Prices are a bit up.  Burritos are a bit wet and fall apart sometimes.  Well it satisfies my cravings and that's all that matters.
author: Doogie H.

description:
Meh. I've never had anything particularly good here. It satisfies the burrito craving in the same way dominos satisfies the pizza craving - the letter of the law, if not the spirit.
The Only reason to go here is that it's the only taqueria within an easy walk of the main North Beach drag. San Jose Taqueria at Mason & Francisco is better, but boy, if you're really craving a Burrito, you've gotta head to the Mission - 'Little Italy' ain't burrito country.
author: Eric D.

description: Maybe it's because I'm drunk every time I come here, but the suiza quesadillas are to die for.
author: Rego S.

description: Pretty tasty Mexican food for a neighborhood spot.  I recommend ordering your burrito with the extras - avocado, sour cream, etc - as some items do not come with it already.  The horchata is just decent.  Huge portions of everything.
author: Tamar N.

description: their food is amazing..and at good price....zorro burrito all the way
author: Amanda A.

description: Since brevity is the soul of wit, I will be brief, this taqueria is awful. Some of the most boring burritos I've ever had. If there was a half decent Mexican place in North Beach this place wouldn't stand a chance.
author: Robert P.

description: I've been past here probably a couple thousand times and never have tried it out because I have a bias against restaurants next door to strip clubs or porno shops.  But, I had a 2-for-1 burito coupon and my appreciation for value trumps my porn/food mixing rule.  Anyway, the place offers 10 kinds of meat and the interior was not bad.  Lots of Mexican patrons, soccer on the TV, and colorful decorations on the ceiling gave an air of authenticity.  The carne asada was good and the other meats I saw on other tables looked appealing; I just thought my burito was a bit soupy.  I will ask for no beans next times as I believe they were the culprit.  It was a satisfying experience, but nothing to rave about.  With a 3 rating, I basically say "If I'm in the area and in the mood for this type of food, it's a fine choice"  Other people in my party liked it more than me, so probably can be considered a good potential for an upgrade if I ever go again.  http://taqueriazorro.com/
author: Marc S.

description: The quesadilla is pretty good, but you really cant mess that up. Its good enough to satisfy the hunger pangs, but its a little pricey so I wouldn't make it a habit.....
author: Hector A.

description: Really good mexican food for a good price.  I cant think of anything witty to say.
author: iPunchfish -.

description: Didn't expect to find a money burrito spot in North Beach but Zorro gets the job done. Very good burritos with great meats and pretty decently sized. After a night out on Broadway, Zorro is the perfect place to soothe the soul, sober up, and down 1500 late night calories. The line is crazy long after 2am.
author: Ed L.

description: Zorro Burrito (with fries in it, soaking up all the delicious heart-stopping juices) was so good. The guacamole was terrible, not worth dipping chips in.
author: Kyle S.

description: Had  super burrito. It was pretty good. I wanted to get the mojado, but the place is cash only. There was a lot of meat. The burrito was $7.54 with tax. The sauces are not that hot so play on! Lots of seating and computer jukebox. And tv's.
author: Andrew Y.

description: I work nearby Zorro so I've been here several times. I wouldn't call it one of the best taquerias out there but it's pretty good. The burritos are quite large and very filling. For me, it's all about the sauce that they marinate their meat in and it is pretty good. Unfortunately, it's also pretty oily though that's not really surprising. If you're at North Beach and craving Mexican (for whatever weird reason), check out Zorro's.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Been here too many times to count.  Just good mexi food that is somewhat overpriced.  But in the overpriced section of SF that is North Beach I'll take it.  Veggie Tacos rule here!!!!
author: Tito C.

description: One of the better Mexican places in the North Beach. Their menu is pretty much the same as most places. Their burrito is not Mission Street good, but it serves its purpose. The alhambres is decent, and so are the flautas. Definitely worth walking from Battery Street for.
author: Rommel N.

description: Unlike Gil S., I quite like their fish tacos. Today they were especially yummy and I asked what kind of fish they used (Tilapia). The fish is sauteed instead of fried in a kind of a hot saucy loveliness. The taco is simply dressed, 2 small steamed corn tortillas, onion and cilantro. I opted to add a little sliced avocado, which made me very happy. Don't get me wrong, I love a nice fried fish taco but a girl has her figure to consider.
author: Isabella R.

description: Finding good Mexican food by my job is hard. I'm near Chinatown and the financial  district so Chinese food and American food is easier to find. My bosses and co-worker were getting burritos from here one day and asked if I wanted one. I hesitated thinking the place might be Rubios or Green Salsa but I asked for a burrito and I was not disappointed. Good Mexican food, their veggie burrito is a good choice when your feeling a little guilty about calories and their tortas look pretty good too. Good salsa bar as well!!!
author: Shirley E.

description: Passable if you're desperate for mexican food, but the taste of the food barely surpasses Chipotle. Prices are way too high, servers are way too mean. Plus, for some reason, it seems to attract the most exceptionally prickish drunks on Friday/Saturday night. I went there more than once, and after a while figured out what on the menu could be made okay, so I can't give it less than two stars, but I sure as hell can't give it more.
author: Wayne W.

description:
What, you mean to tell me you DONT have to go to the mission for decent Mexican food? I havent spent much time exploring the Mission, but Zorro's is by far the best mexican food ive had this side of Market! It's nice and cheap, and QUICK, like Mexican should be. My only qualm is that their horchata is a little grainy, which does not make for a tasty drink, but the resolution is that they sell buckets of coronas as well...who needs horchata when you can wash your burrito down with a bucket of coronitas? 

The decor is a little cheesy as well. Seating is in the back and it has a semi-cafeteria feel to it. There is a jukebox that plays super spanish music and a tv that is usually playing an old boxing match. Not a classy place but a great one if you're looking for a quick, delcious, fatty meal.
author: Sarah I.

description: this is the best taqueria around my office so far.  The burritos are hefty and they don't skimp on anything.  The quality/quantity is also very good for the price... it's less than $8 for a super burrito.  It's definitely a consistent performer and it's my go-to spot for a lunch-time burrito.
author: grant l.

description: Probably one of the best burritos I've had in a long ass time. But I paid a lot of money for it and the service was pretty weak. I stood at the counter while the woman cleaned for like 5 minutes. It wasn't a huge deal, but a mood killer. What I really liked is how they mixed my black beans with cheese so that they didn't fall out. Yummy.
author: Jenna R.

description: Loved the Torta with Carnitas. Late night Friday it's the perfect cure for a hangover. Excelent service, cold Negra Modelo, chips were average.
author: James K.

description: Not bad, I always get the Steak Plate on my way to work if I'm in the mood for mexican. I went here late last nite as my roommate was craving some burritos. I ordered only two tacos and they were a mixture of heat and spiciness. Would I come back? I have already. But would I go to another taco place before this? I would if it was more convenient than this.
author: Eric R.

description: The chicken burrito here is pretty awesome. So good that I actually get a craving for it, it's a pretty authentic place in the heart of North Beach definitely worth a try for some tasty Mexican food.
author: Olga P.

description: Great place 'El Zorros'... I only really eat here when im 'El Skinto' as North Beach has many other healthier alternatives.  The burritos are the size of new born babies... Although i find it annoying when i get given a takeaway bag when i plan on eating in...
author: Barnie M.

description: this place is great if you're looking for a cheap carnitas taco and some beans--  and i always am!  seriously.  fast, affordable, tasty, friendly, easy... what else do you need?  i'm down.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: well i've been eating here sporadically for a few years cuz it's next to my work, and the only thing close to a decent taqueria in north beach.  mediocre at best, they get the job done if yr in a pinch.
author: eric i.

description: probably the best taqueria in north beach!  but really, it ain't bad!
author: Jill k.

description: Best burritos in the area financial district or north beach (San Jose Taquera #3 is good but way out of the way).  They make large burritos with a large amount of meat and great fillings.  The salsa bar is great with several really good versions of the standard salsas.  Warning: their hot sauce contains chopped jalapeno peppers and I would advice ordering the mild sauce.
author: Ture A.

description: dependable, al pastor, quick and efficient ... and how about football 24/7 ... in north beach?  pour me another cold one ...
author: tim y.

description: I was shocked to find good Mexican in North Beach! I was a little buzzed from drinking at Pearl's so I don't quite remember what kind of taco I got, but I'm pretty sure it was carne asada. It was SPICY!!!!! Oh wow I must have guzzled 4 glasses of water after one taco. But I must say it was a mighty tasty taco. If I go back I will definitely ask for something milder! If you like spicy this is the place for you!
author: N. M.

description: Best super casadilla in the world. Try it and you will be amazed
author: Nick v.

description: Very mediocre. Could someone open a taqueria in North Beach???
author: Heidi P.
